assoc_actor_1: #group+name+first+assoc
assoc_actor_2: #group+name+second+assoc
notes: #description

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 11 February. During the night, Imbonerakure broke into a house in the Nyamugari neighborhood of Gitega. The homeowner stabbed one of the intruders, injuring him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 10 February. Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kaguhu, Gasorwe. The perpetrators had ordered the victim to pay them a fine but he did not have the money to do so.
09 February (on or before). The head of an unidentified man was found in Carama. Military socks and boots were found at the location. Police launched an investigation.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 09 February. An unidentified group set fire to the home of a man (who was a member of the CNDD-FDD) accused of witchcraft in Burimbi, Cibitoke. The man and two of his children died in the fire.

08 February. An unidentified armed group killed a man during an attack on the Lumitel communication company in Muyange (no coordinates available, located in the Nyarusange area). The perpetrators also destroyed a generator.
07 February. A mob of people attacked a man accused of being a witch doctor in the Nkayamba neighborhood of Rumonge. The attackers wounded the man with a machete.
06 February (on or before). Residents of Kinyankonge and Nyabagere protested in Bujumbura over land seizures by the government.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 06 February. Imbonerakure assaulted an elderly man, accused of witchcraft, in Bugabira. They also demanded money from the victim.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 06 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a child who was selling food items in Bubanza, after the child asked them to pay for the goods they consumed.
06 February. An unidentified group threw a grenade into a home in the Kararire neighborhood of Kagege. The attack is reported to stem from witchcraft accusations.

05 February (on or before). A motor-taxi resisted a bribe to a police officer, who then attempted to seize the drivers' bike. At which time, other drivers reportedly threw stones at the police officer, who responded by shooting and killing the driver.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 04 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNDD-FDD member in Butezi for not following their instructions on assaulting and intimidating the civilian population. The police did not take any action after the victim filed a complaint against the Imbonerakure members.
03 February. A grenade was thrown into a bar in Kaburantwa, injuring seven people.
03 February (on or before). A grenade was thrown into a home in Rugasa, injuring two people. The perpetrator is believed to be a local resident who fled after the attack.
03 February (on or before). A female body was discovered along the Ruvubu river in Shombo. Local sources believe the victim had been killed elsewhere before being dumped into the river.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 03 February. A group of Imbonerakure assaulted a police officer and stole his weapon in Matongo. Other police officers responded by firing into the air to disperse the attackers. Nine Imbonerakure members were arrested over the incident.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 03 February. A woman was severely beaten by locals after she was accused of stealing potatoes in Biganda. The woman suffered a miscarriage as a result of the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: 02 February. A contingent of Burundian soldiers crossed back into the Cibitoke province from the DRC, where they had carried out operations against Red TABARA and other Burundian armed groups.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Herders (Burundi)
notes: 01 February. Imbonerakure from Musanga attacked a group of herders from Vugizo, whom they believed were responsible for bush fires. The two groups clashed (both sides assumed armed).

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 31 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and stole the weapons of two police officers in Kibati, Cibitoke. The military intervened and detained the Imbonerakure.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 31 January. A grenade was thrown into the home of a FNL-Rwasa member in Cewe, Kirundo. Some speculate that the family was targeted over their political affiliation, while others believe the attack was due to witchcraft accusations.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 30 January (on or before). Imbonerakure seriously assaulted a FNL-Rwasa supporter with sticks and drowning for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: 30 January. Two members of the political opposition were arrested and tortured by the national intelligence service in Gatete, Rumonge. The detainees were involved in a land dispute with a CNDD-FDD leader and the intelligence officers accused them of conspiring with armed groups.
28 January. Police raided the home of an FNL member in Gabaniro and seized grenades.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 January. Military forces were ambushed by rebels from the DRC in the Rukoko forest, Gihanga. Three soldiers were killed and others were seriously injured. Additional soldiers were deployed to the Rukoko Nature Reserve following the attack, while access to the reserve was banned.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 27 January. Three armed men attacked a CNDD-FDD member near the Nyabikere dam. The victim was stabbed in the face but managed to escape.
27 January (on or before). A body was discovered in the Ruvyironza river near Giheta. The victim appeared to have been killed then dumped into the river.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 27 January. Unidentified perpetrators threw a grenade into a bar in Buterere. The local Imbonerakure leader and his wife were injured in the attack, along with six others.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 27 January. An unidentified armed group from the DRC attacked a military position in the Rukoro forest, near Gihanga. Three soldiers were killed.
26 January. Police and the local chief tied-up and tortured a man in Butamuheba. They held the man over night while they tortured him to confess to impregnating a woman.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 26 January (on or around). The body of a CNDD-FDD member was discovered in Busimba. The victim's arms and tongue had been cut off.
26 January. A grenade was thrown into a market in Mpanda.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 26 January. A man was killed in Gisuma (no coordinates available), in the Rugabano district. The attack is believed to be related to witchcraft accusations.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 26 January. A mob destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft in the Gihwanya neighborhood of Rumonge.
26 January. A grenade was thrown into the Gifurwe market. Five suspects were later arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: 25 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a member of the FRODEBU in Mirango. They accused him of adultery.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 25 January. A FNL-Rwasa member was beaten to death in his home in Kigarama by suspected Imbonerakure members

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 25 January. A grenade was thrown into the home of a FNL Rwasa member in Cewe. Local sources believe the family was targeted over witchcraft accusations.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 25 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and stripped a man in Ngugo. They also stole his phone. The perpetrators were arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 23 January. A member of the Imbonerakure raped a teenager in Rwamvura. The perpetrator was arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 23 January. Imbonerakure assaulted, detained, and extorted money from a woman in Gashingwa.
21 January. Police in Kabanga arrested a youth, they suspected of supporting rebels. They assaulted the youth in the prison and later transferred him and another suspect to a prison in Busoni.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 21 January. Residents in the Birimba neighborhood of Rumonge, caught a robber and killed him. Three of the perpetrators were arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: 21 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a woman in Nyamutobo. The perpetrators said that Tutsi were not permitted in the chief's bar.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 20 January. An Imbonerakure member in Jimbi beat a man over the head with a bottle. The perpetrator was arrested.
20 January. Police arrested a youth in Kabanga. They accused him of supporting rebels and repeatedly beat him. On 21/01 they transferred him to a prison in Busoni.
19 January (on or before). A resident of Kinzanza was killed by his neighbors following a land dispute.
19 January. A grenade was thrown at a group of people, including a police officer, in Mutakura. Three people were killed and others were injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 17 January. Imbonerakure assaulted two women in the Kamege area of Murwi. They then took the women to the police, who detained them for two days.
16 January. A man and his son were stabbed to death in Butaganzwa. Local leaders suspect they were killed over a land dispute.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 16 January. Angry residents in Butaganzwa beat a man to death with clubs. They believed he was responsible for stabbing two locals earlier in the day.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Burundi)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a school director in Gasenyi until a ransom was paid.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted the chief in Nyakibari. The perpetrators were later arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a man with clubs in his home in Mugimbu. They targeted the man over witchcraft accusations.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 15 January (on or before). The body of an Imbonerakure member, who worked for the aviation authority, was discovered in Bujumbura. The victim appeared to have been strangled to death.

assoc_actor_2: Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: 15 January. A Tutsi was abducted from Ngozi by unknown perpetrators on 15/01. His body was discovered in Kayanza on 16/01. Local sources suspect the victim was targeted due to his ethnicity.
14 January (on or before). A body was discovered in Bugiga, the victim had been tied up and strangled. According to locals, the body had not been deceased long as it had no signs of swelling.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 14 January. A CNDD-FDD leader assaulted a female Rwasa supporter in a shop in Cimba.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 13 January. A group of youth in Mugoboka (no coordinates available, located in south Mutanga) accused a man, suffering from psychological problems, of being a rebel and beat him to death.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 13 January. Two men were killed in Nyaruganda by locals (assumed unarmed) who suspected them of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 13 January. Soldiers assaulted two Imbonerakure members in Kiyonza in retaliation for an attack on a soldier by Imbonerakure on 09/01.

assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: 12 January. A member of Amizero yAbarundi was arrested and tortured by police in Nyamitanga. As of 15/12 he remained in police custody. The police have denied torturing the detainee.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 12 January. After catching suspected robbers in Rugabano, Imbonerakure and security forces tortured the suspects.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 12 January. Imbonerakure detained and assaulted the chief of the Busaga neighborhood in Kinzanza for being out during the night. Police intervened, securing the release of the chief.
11 January. Military forces stationed near Munibhere (no coordinates available), between Sehe and Nyagumba shot at suspected rebels in the Kibira forest.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 10 January. Imbonerakure severely assaulted two brothers during a patrol in Muhweza.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 10 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a teenager in Rambo with clubs.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 09 January. Armed men in military fatigues killed a CNDD-FDD member in Bukinanyana, after stealing money from him and his wife. Unknown identity of perpetrator coded as UAG.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 09 January. Imbonerakure members attacked a soldier in Kiyonza.
08 January (on or before). A 60 year old man was killed in Mukoma over a mining dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 08 January. Imbonerakure with clubs, bows and arrows beat a man in Buhiga for being out during the night and took him to the police station.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 08 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a merchant in Munyika for selling their coals without repaying them for the product.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: 06 January. Imbonerakure assaulted four members of theAmizero yAbarundi in Nyamitanga.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 06 January. Imbonerakure beat and stabbed a man who was crossing from DRC into Burundi during the night, near Rugombo. Two arrests were made following the attack.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 05 January (on or before). Imbonerakure and police in Rugombo have robbed and assaulted the local population. One man was beaten by the police for not giving them a beer, while another man was robbed by the group.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 05 January. Members of the CNDD-FDD destroyed the home of a FNL-Rwasa supporter.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 05 January. Armed men beat a woman suspected of witchcraft. They also destroyed her home.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
notes: 05 January. The UPD-Zigamibangaen leader in Butaganzwa was assaulted by Imbonerakure.
05 January. A grenade was thrown into a house in Kavomo, injuring three people - including children.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 05 January. Imbonerakure beat a woman in Mudaturwa, accusing her of witchcraft. After her husband filed a complaint, the Imbonerakure and local chief fined the man. When he refused to pay, they stole materials from his home to sell.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 03 January. Imbonerakure from Musenyi fought with Imbonerakure and a police officer in Mpanda, after the police officer had arrested one of their friends.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: 03 January. Imbonerakure assaulted two members of the Amizero yAbarundi in Rugajo (no coordinates available), Buganda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 03 January. Imbonerakure beat a man accused of witchcraft in Bugera, then turned him over to the police
03 January (on or around). A body was discovered in Gihosha. A local official indicated the person had been killed elsewhere before the perpetrators left the body in Gihosha.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: 03 January. Two men cut the throat of a university student, as they suspected his father of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 02 January. A man was beaten with wood planks by four Imbonerakure in Bubanza. One perpetrator was arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 02 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa supporter in Kigoganya, then took him to the prison where he was held until the following day hen he paid a fine and promised to join the CNDD-FDD.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 02 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a motorbike driver in Nyakibari. The local chief tried to intervene but was assaulted as well.
01 January. Police assaulted and arrested a merchant in Murwi for raising his prices.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 01 January. Imbonerakure stabbed and robbed a man in Rugombo. Another man was also beaten-up by Imbonerakure on the same night.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 01 January. Imbonerakure tortured a 14 year old boy, who was a CNDD-FDD member, in Kigoma, in an attempt to get the boy to confess to raping a child. They later took the boy to the police.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 31 December (on or before). A group of residents destroyed a man's home in Gashanga, suspecting him of witchcraft. The police arrested the victim and leader of the perpetrators.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 31 December. A merchant, who belonged to the CNDD-FDD, in Ryamukona was beaten by police before they detained him and transferred him to an unknown location. The police alleged the man had possession of firearms, but locals report that the beating and arrest were done to avoid debts.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 31 December. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in the Ruremba are of Nyakazi for being out past the curfew.
30 December. The body of a man was discovered in the Mubarazi river in Bugendana. The victim had been tied up with a rope.
29 December. Protesters marched in Bujumbura, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 29 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa member in Gatabo for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD.
29 December. Protesters demonstrated in Bururi, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.
29 December. Protesters gathered in Muramvya, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.
29 December. Protesters gathered in Rumonge, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 29 December. Imbonerakure beat a CNDD-FDD member to death for not participating in communal work in Nyamirambo (no coordinates available), in the Masango area. The perpetrators were arrested but were released by the area chief.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: 27 December (on or before). A Rwandan trader was apprehended by Imbonerakure in a Cibitoke market. The Imbonerakure beat the man and stole his money before taking him to the SNR police. The police then tortured the man before taking him to an unknown location.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 25 December. A police officer shot a member of the Imbonerakure (assumed unarmed) in Kinyinya.
24 December. A body, which showed signs of torture and bullet wounds, was discovered on the shore of Lake Tanganyika in Bujumbura.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 23 December. A man stealing sweet potatoes was killed by an unknown group. Assumed mob violence.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 21 December. An unidentified group killed a CNDD-FDD member and injured the man's wife.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 21 December. Two suspected thieves were caught by locals in Kavumwe. The group beat one to death and police intervened to save the other.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 20 December. Imbonerakure assaulted two civilians in Hamure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: 20 December. The president of the MSD party in Ngoro was assaulted by the Imbonerakure chief.
19 December. A police officer was abducted in Ruhororo. The zone chief and eight others were arrested in connection with the abduction.
19 December. A woman and three of her children were killed by a grenade in Kavomo. Three other children were injured. The attack stemmed from witchcraft accusations and a suspect was arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 18 December. Imbonerakure and police assaulted two men for breaking curfew in Gihanga. One of the men was detained until he paid a fine the following day.
18 December. An armed group decapitated a man in Mpanda. Arrests were made.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 16 December. According to local sources, Imbonerakure were deployed in Bukinanyana to carry out night patrols between Nyamitanga and Bukinanyana. The Imbonerakure were armed.

16 December. Heavy military movement was seen around Musigati. Locals indicated that the forces were deployed into the forest to search for armed groups. A local official reported that it was they were carrying out routine operations.
16 December. A 50 year-old man was killed with machetes by unidentified attackers. The attack is reported to have stemmed from witchcraft accusations.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Bujumbura protested against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. The protest was organized by the Ministry of Interior and other government agencies.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 15 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Buvumbi for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD election fund and insulting the party. After they beat the man and took him to the local jail.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Gitega protested against the BBC's report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Kirundo demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. They objected to any bystanders on the side of the road, to prevent anyone from taking pictures.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Muramvya demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Ngozi demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo.
15 December (on or before). Two male bodies were discovered in Gafumbegeti (no coordinates available). They had been killed and tied to trees.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Cankuzo protested against the BBC's report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Makamba demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. Many of the protesters were forced to participate.
13 December. A woman was beaten and raped by a group of men in the Banda area of Kibuya village.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

They have not been seen or heard from since.

notes: 22 October. During the night, soldiers mistakenly shot and killed two fishermen in the Rukoko forest. They mistook them for rebels.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 22 October. A man beat an eighty year-old to death, accusing him of witchcraft.
21 October. Two police officers attacked a bar in Kagoma. They fired their weapons and assaulted the customers, injuring one person. The attackers were later arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 21 October. A man was beaten by the local head of the CNDD-FDD in Gitaramuka before being taken to the local detention facility.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 21 October. A member of the Imbonerakure broke into the house of a widow in Murama and attempted to rape her. He then beat her.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 October. An armed group crossed into Nyamitanga from the DRC and attacked a military base. Four soldiers were killed and six were injured during the attack.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 20 October. Imbonerakure members assaulted a FNL Rwasa supporter in Rango. They attacked the man for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD. They then forced him to sell his livestock and give them the money.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: 20 October. Imbonerakure in Rutambiro beat and detained a member of the FRODEBU. The police intervened and made arrests. The victim was later released.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 20 October. Women from the CNDD-FDD held a march in Makamba to show their strength.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 19 October. A civilian motorcyclist was beaten and arrested by police in Rusaka. He was a member of the Imbonerakure and was was accused of having criticised new police officers the previous day.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 18 October (on or around). Military forces, along with Imbonerakure and police have been patrolling the border with Rwanda around Ruhwa.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 13 October. Imbonerakure in Kivoga assaulted a man and his wife for having visitors.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: 13 October. A UPRONA supporter in Munyinya was killed by unknown assailants.

assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Burundi)
actor2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
notes: 11 October. Prisoners in Gitega began revolting over the food in the prison and threw rocks. The prison guards utilized tear gas and live ammunition to restore order.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 10 October. Imbonerakure attacked a trader who was returning to Bugwana from Muyinga. They also robbed him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 09 October. A member of the Imbonerakure killed a man over a land dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 09 October. An Imbonerakure member in Muzya killed a man over a land dispute. He was later arrested.

assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Burundi)
notes: 09 October (on or before). CNDD-FDD party officials, along with Imbonerakure and local police detained a Matongo teacher, who was an MSD supporter. The teacher has not been seen since. This disappearance coincides with a larger persecution of teachers who support opposition parties in Matongo.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Burundi)
notes: 09 October (on or before). A teacher in Matongo was beaten by Imbonerakure. The incident occurred as CNDD-FDD in Matongo are targeting teachers who support the MSD party.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 08 October. Imbonerakure tortured a man who had recently returned home after seeking refuge in Rwanda. They then took him to a facility for "correction and recovery."

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 08 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Nyabikere for not paying his bar tab.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 08 October. Locals in Bukwavu caught a thief and tried to set him on fire. Police intervened.
07 October. An armed group believed to be from Rwanda attacked two households in Mugina. One woman and two children were killed during the attack.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 07 October. A woman was killed by unknown assailants in Mutaho. She had been accused of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 07 October. A woman was assaulted by two Imbonerakure members in Bwoga. The victim tried to collect payments owed to her by one of the assailants before they beat her.

notes: 07 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL Rwasa supporter in the Mungwa area. The attackers were arrested.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 06 October. Imbonerakure tied up and beat up two FNL Rwasa supporters in Rango. After assaulting the victims, the perpetrators threw them into a small river.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 05 October (on or around). An angry mob lynched a taxi driver in Rumonge. He died from his injuries at the hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 05 October. A member of the Imbonerakure assaulted a woman in Murwi after she went to repay a debt.
04 October. A grenade injured two people in Musaga. It is suspected that the attack was intended for police who often patrol the area at night.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 04 October. A man in Kirambi was killed after being accused of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 03 October. Imbonerakure tried to lynch a thief but the military intervened.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 03 October. Police in Yaranda beat a FNL-Rwasa supporter. They accused him of witchcraft.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: 03 October. Six Imbonerakure members assaulted a MSD supporter in Ninga for not donating to the 2020 elections.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 02 October. Imbonerakure members killed a woman in Nyabibuye. They accused her of witchcraft. The perpetrators were later arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 02 October. A woman in Kinzanza was beaten by Imbonerakure members who accused her of having a lover.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 01 October. Imbonerakure assaulted a man for the shirt he was wearing.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: 01 October. A man was killed by unknown assailants after he was accused of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 29 September. A man was beaten with clubs and machetes by Imbonerakure in Rugombo. The attack was reportedly over a land dispute between the man and his brothers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 29 September. Imbonerakure and the local chief of Marembo beat a man for not paying CNDD party dues.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 28 September. While on patrol, soldiers from the Rukina base and Imbonerakure reportedly raped a woman.
28 September (on or around). The body of a slain woman was discovered in Mikore. The body appears to have been dumped in the location after she was killed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Burundi)

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 27 September. Imbonerakure in Kayogoro beat two youth for being out at night.

25 September. The body of a woman who appears to have been murdered was discovered in Mugina. No details on when she might have been killed (time precision coded as 3).

assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: 24 September. An Amizero man was beaten in Buganda by a member of the Imbonerakure and National Intelligence agency for not attending the protest against the UN.

24 September. Men armed with explosives and machetes threw a grenade in a family home in Mugina. At least one child was killed (other sources indicate a woman was killed as well). Locals suspect they were targeted due to witchcraft accusations, others indicated it was due to a land dispute.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: 24 September. Attackers burned down a home, while the owner was still inside. The man was seriously injured. The attackers reportedly believed the man was a witch.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 24 September. Soldiers and Imbonerakure in Rukina reportedly raped a woman.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 23 September. Imbonerakure beat a civilian in Gashikanwa.

22 September. Demonstrators marched in Bujumnbura to call on the government to withdraw from the UN Human Rights Council, following the organization's recent report on human rights violations and abuses within the country.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)

assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation

notes: 22 September. Five members of the Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa member.

notes: 22 September. A grenade struck the outside of the Police Commissioner's home. He escaped unhurt. Police arrested 10 people in a bar soon after.
21 September. Residents of Butahana demonstrated against a Russian mining company in the area. The demonstrators threw stones at the police who fired shots into the air to disperse the demonstration.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)

notes: 20 September. The body of an Imbonerakure member was found in Rusengo. The blood had been drained and the murder is believed to be linked to witchcraft.

notes: 19 September. Imbonerakure beat and detained 16 members of FNL-Rwasa in Musenyi. The members had gathered at a house for a meeting. After beating the members, the Imbonerakure took them to the police station.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 19 September. Imbonerakure attacked a bar in Muyinga, injuring several people, three severely. The attackers reportedly targeted the bar as the owner had not paid the group.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 18 September. An unidentified armed group killed a member of the Imbonerakure and his wife in Kabarore, decapitating the man and keeping his head. Some suspect the perpetrators came from Rwanda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 18 September. Imbonerakure broke into the house of two sisters members of their party in Gatete and demanded them to pay a bribe. When they refused, the Imbonerakure assaulted them, breaking the arm of one of them.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 18 September. The house of an Imbonerakure member in Bugenyuzi was set on fire by unknown perpetrators.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 17 September. While on a night patrol in Nyabiraba, an Imbonerakure member attacked a civilian with a machete for walking at night. The man protected himself with a barrel and escaped uninjured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 17 September. A member of the Imbonerakure beat a pregnant woman, causing her to miscarry. He reportedly attacked her for selling drinks without the permission of the Imbonerakure.
16 September. An old man was stabbed and severly injured by unknown perpetrators in Munyinya. The motive is unknown but some speculate the attack stemmed from witchcraft accusations.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: 16 September. Two men threw a grenade into a CNDD-FDD members house in Nyabigabiro, seriously injuring one. The attack was reportedly part of a land dispute.

15 September. The local administration in Mabayi is forcing civilians to patrol along the border with Rwanda at night. The decision was reportedly taken to prevent rebels from crossing the border into the country. Locals have spoken out against the order, saying it is the job of the military and the police and they are not capable of patrolling the borders if they are unarmed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

15 September. Protesters gathered across Burundi to voice their opposition to the recent UN report on human rights abuses in the country. Specific locations of protest were not named.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 September. An unidentified group from the DRC attacked a military base near the border, in the Bujumbura province. One attacker was killed and one police officer was wounded. Local officials reported the group intended to rob a bank.
14 September. A soldier raped a local woman in her 50s in Matongo. He was later apprehended by local police.
12 September (on or around). The body of a man was discovered in Migera. It appeared that he had been stabbed. Date, perpetrators and motive remain unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 12 September. A member of the Imbonerakure beat a man in Muzingi. The reasons for the attack are unknown.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: 09 September. A UPRONA supporter was abducted and beaten by Imbonerakure for not donating to the CNDD party. They abandoned the victim, who was later discovered and taken to the hospital.
10 September. The body of a local man was found in Gatoke. Neighbors believed he was killed the night before. The perpetrators and motive for the attack are unknown.
08 September. Police forces reportedly clashed with three unidentified armed men in Kayogoro. The assailants left a motorcycle, with a Tanzanian license plate.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: 04 September. A CNDD-FDD member was shot and wounded by by unknown attackers using arrows in Mika. The motive for the attack is unknown, however, it was reported that the CNDD-FDD suspected him of helping the political opposition.
Weapons seizure: 02 September. Police announced the discovery of bombs, a Kalashnikov, and ammunition in Rummonge.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 02 September. A member of the Imbonerakure abducted and raped a 16 year old girl. She was held for two days before being freed.

assoc_actor_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
notes: 02 September. A man in a police uniform and another armed accomplice shot two people in Ngozi. The reason for the attack is unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 01 September. Two members of the Imbonerakure beat up a man for missing community work in Cibitoke, Bukinanyana commune. They then sent him to prison.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 01 September (on or around). Five Imbonerakure attacked a man in Karehe for allegedly speaking ill of the CNDD. The victim was hospitalized for two weeks due to the severity of the injuries. The attackers were arrested.

notes: Two Imbonerakure from Rwimbogo hill in Masango area of Bukinanyana commune of Cibitoke Province beat up a CNDD-FDD man from the locality on 1 September 2018. They blamed the victim for being absent from community work.

Soldiers on patrol discovered a bag of ammunition and RPG bombs on September 1, 2018 in a forest on Rusabagi hill and area of Burambi commune in Rumonge province. The weapons seized included three RPG bombs, over 200 Kalashnikov cartridges and over 400 machine gun cartridges.

31 August. A man was killed when unidentified attackers threw a grenade into the victim's home in Ngozi. According to local human rights sources, he was the third person killed in the province during the week (no information on the other deaths).

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Lawyers (Burundi)
notes: A group of Imbonerakure manhandled a lawyer based on the orders of Kiyange hill chief in Kiyange area of Kibago commune in Makamba province on August 31, 2018. The lawyer was on a field visit in order to prepare a defense for a land dispute case.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A group of Imbonerakure nearly killed a FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Muhagaze hill in Mugaruro area of Gishubi commune in Gitega province on August 31, 2018. The assailants accused him of encouraging the population to vote "No" in the referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A CNDD-FDD member from Myave Hill in Ndora area of Bukinyana commune in Cibitoke province was killed by knives and bludgeons by a group of men on 29 August 2018. The perpetrators and motive for the killing are unknown. It is unclear whether the political affiliation of the victim played a role.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: Residents of Ngoma area of Murwi commune in Cibitoke province destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft on August 28, 2018. The family managed to escape.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Burundi)
notes: Three radio journalists were detained and severely beaten by the police in Ngagara area of Ntahangwa commune in Bujumbura Mairie on August 27, 2018 as they reported on a land dispute between the local community and the administration.
On or around 27 August. Local human rights sources report that two people were killed in Ngozi province in the week of 27 August (no information on circumstances).

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: A man from Mugendo hill of Muhuta area in Rumonge province was stoned by residents of the hill on August 27, 2018. The assailants accused him of having killed a woman and her child through bewitchment.

A driver of Burundi Red Cross was shot in the leg by a police officer of the Anti-Riot Brigade (BAE) on August 26, 2018 in Kinindo area of Ntahangwa commune in Bujumbura Mairie. The BAE agent shot the victim as he was arguing with another man in a bar.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Burundi)
notes: An elderly farmer was killed by five men at his home on Rushanga hill in Mugera area of Bugendana commune in Gitega province on 26 August 2018. It is suspected that the case might be linked to accusations of witchcraft yet the motive was unconfirmed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member from Burangwa hill in Magara area of Bugarama commune in Rumonge province was beaten by Imbonerakure members on August 26th, 2018 in Nyamwari Valley. The victim was seriously wounded.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: A MSD member from Bugendana Displaced Persons Camp in Gitega province was abducted in a vehicle of the provincial police from Mukoro on 26 August 2018.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: A police officer tortured a prisoner at Bubanza police station on August 26, 2018. The victim was severely wounded. The policeman assaulted the victim due to an alleged extramarital relationship.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A resident of Murama hill was beaten by Imbonerakure youth on Gasave hill of Ntega area and commune of Kirundo province on August 26, 2018. The victim was accused of witchcraft because of a dental apparatus he had been carrying with him.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi); Islamic Group (Burundi)

The Imbonerakure desired to punish all those who had voted "No" in the referendum and who had not joined the CNDD-FDD party.

Movement of forces: on 20 July, a group of between 20 and 30 unidentified armed men entered the Kibira forest through Nyarubugu locality, Ndora zone of Bukinanyana commune. Burundi soldiers pursued them and found 12 cartridges left by this group. These Burundian soldiers are still stationed in Kibira.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: On 20 July, a member of UPRONA pro-Charles Nditije from Rugoma locality, Ninga zone in Butaganzwa commune was beaten by Imbonerakure. They reproached him for not having paid a contribution which he owes to the CNDD-FDD.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure youth from Kivoga sub-hill on Kibago hill, area and commune of Makamba province beat up, intimidated and extorted 8000 BIF from two men returning from a party on 20 July 2018.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Movement of forces: Between 16-22 July, some Imbonerakure were deployed in different localities in Bunyerere, Gisagara zone and Bumba, and the Camazi zone in Gisagara commune, bordering Tanzania, to officially "regulate border security". According to local sources, these young people from the CNDD-FDD were reportedly deployed there to confront armed men that set up ambushes and stole money and other goods from the local population. These Imbonerakure also carried out household searches in this commune to track 'rebel groups from Tanzania'.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 18 July, 3 FNL members of the Coalition Amizero y'Abarundi in Busoni commune of Kirundo province were detained, accused by Imbonerakure of contempt of the Head of State. They were reportedly tortured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A woman from Rugarama neighbourhood of Makamba commune and province was beaten by an Imbonerakure as well as the neighbourhood chief on 18 July 2018. The victim was attacked as she was on her way to demand for her husband to come home and stop spending money on drinking.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 17 July, the logistics officer of the police station in Rutegama commune of Muramvya province beat a member of FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa. This policeman accused him of not having paid for his consumption in a bar.

Arrests: on 16 July, 61 people including 9 women were arrested during a police search in Birimba neighborhood of Rumonge town. Among these people, the majority were young people whom police suspect to be members of armed groups. After investigation and identification of these people by the police in collaboration with the leaders of the area, only a dozen people remain detained in the police cell of Rumonge.

actor2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Mass grave: on 16 July, a mass grave was discovered in Buheka, Kazirabageni zone, Nyanza Lac in Makamba province. A man working on the field was arrested but the remains are believed to be from those killed in 1996 in clashes between the Burundi army and CNDD-FDD rebel movement

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 16 July, an Imbonerakure from the center of Bubanza commune assaulted a young girl from the locality over installing a kiosk in front of his house. The victim complained to the police commissioner but the perpetrator was not charged.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: On 14 July, a member of FRODEBU from Rukago locality in Gahombo zone and commune was almost beaten to death by a local chief and deputy of the Imbonerakure. The victim threw a stone at the municipal director of education while inebriated, and the Imbonerakure attacked him in turn. The beating was eventually stopped by other members of the CNDD-FDD.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 14 July, three FNL members from Kibimba locality, Giharo zone and commune, clashed with a group of seven Imbonerakure who surrounded and attacked them. The Imbonerakure attacked anyone who voted "No" in the constitutional referendum. The communal police commissioner arrested FNL militants and their local leader for not informing the administration about this incident in his locality.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 13 July, two young men who were coming back from Ndava commune were arrested and beaten by three members of the Imbonerakure from Bihororo locality, Giheta zone and commune. The CNDD-FDD youths accused them of walking around without their national identity cards.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 13 July, the administrator of Mukike commune beat a Judicial Police Officer in a pub located in Mukike locality, Mayuyu zone. He accused him of 'making too much noise', but local sources suggest that the beating intended to humiliate the victim after he had arrested two young members of the Imbonerakure accused of theft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teenage girl from Mwanda Hill in Muramba area in Bubanza commune and province was raped by a young Imbonerakure on July 13, 2018. She was found hiding on Kivyuru Hill in the area on July 31, 2018.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 12 July, a member of the Imbonerakure from Jongwe locality, Gishiha zone was seriously wounded after being stabbed by a fellow Imbonerakure whom he accused of being an MSD fighter.
Movement of forces: The Burundian army sent heavily armed soldiers to the border with Rwanda (near the Ruhororo and Rutorero hills) after reports of armed attacks in Rwanda in the past 4 weeks.

On 10 July, one person was seriously injured by a grenade that had been trapped in the town of Rumonge. Two grenades had been trapped but only one exploded. The inhabitants of this locality demand the withdrawal of weapons from the population that illegally holds them.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: On 10 July, a female UPRONA member from Jimbi locality, Kibago zone and commune, was beaten and badly injured by a group of Imbonerakure. They accused her of bewitching a local resident and ordering her to heal him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 10 July, an Imbonerakure who was demobilised as an FDD soldier from Musenyi locality and zone in Mpanda commune tortured a young man. The victim was discovered in a bar in the company of a pro Agathon Rwasa FNL leader.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 9 July, a household of a CNDD-FDD member from Nyamunazi locality, in Kinyinya zone and commune, suffered a grenade attack. One child was killed and the mother with another child were seriously injured. The perpetrators and reasons behind this attack remain unknown.
On 9 July, another group of gunmen attacked on the Gwisuri Common Vumbi Hill in Kirundo Province. Two people were killed and two others injured.

On 9 July, one man was killed, and two others were seriously injured during an armed attack in Rwisuri locality, Bukuba zone and Vumbi commune. A sum of 50,000 BIF was also stolen. The wounded were taken to Kirundo Hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 9 July, a family of three from Kigarama locality, Nyabibuye zone and Butaganzwa commune, was beaten by the Imbonerakure. Those members of the Imbonerakure told them that they were ordered by the zonal chief to drive them out of their field because of a dispute the leader has with them.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 9 July, a 7th grade student was raped by the headmaster of Kivumu Basic School in Gitobe commune. The perpetrator is an influential member of the CNDD-FDD at the communal level and remains free for the moment.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 9 July, a member of the CNDD-FDD from the centre of Kayogoro commune was shot dead. The victim is a returnee who had recently returned from Tanzania. Land issues seem to be the motive behind the murder. Four people - a retired army officer, a member of Sahwanya Frodebu, a member of pro-Charles Nditije Uprona and a driver were arrested. They are currently being held in a communal cell.
On 9 July, a woman was seriously injured in a grenade explosion that targeted a kiosk in Iteba zone, Rumonge Town. Another grenade that had not exploded was defused by the police the following day.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: On 8 July, an MSD activist from Rango Commune was beaten and wounded in the head by two members of the Imbonerakure, accusing him of being a funds collector for the "rebels".

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 8 July, Imbonerakure in Rukiga locality, Mugaruro zone and Gishubi commune, arrested and tortured a resident. They took him from his home because he allegedly stole beans. They tied him up and whipped him all night before releasing him on 9 July. The Imbonerakure behind this act were not arrested.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Burundi (2005-)
notes: The administrator of Ruhororo commune together with her guard beat a pregnant woman on Cagura hill in Ruhororo area of Ngozi province on 8 July 2018. The administrator reproached the victim and her husband, a bar owner, for working late at their business.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 7 July, some Imbonerakure coming from Ruhehe zone armed with Kalshnikov rifles attacked the household of a CNDD-FDD member shopkeeper in Bugabira commune. A young student was hit in the thigh by a stray bullet. The same merchant had been the target of an armed attack on Thursday, July 5th.
A man from Nyagaseke hill in Mabayi area and commune of Cibitoke province had his throat slit by unknown assailants on 7 July 2018. He was assassinated due to accusations of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Nyabigina hill in Kabonga area of Nyanza-Lac commune of Makamba province was assaulted by two Imbonerakure youth on 07 July 2018. The victim was wounded.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: Two young men, including a student from Kiyege hill in Rusaka area of Mwaro province, were wounded in a grenade attack during the night from 7 to 8 July 2018. The perpetrators and motives of the attack are unknown. One of the victims was gravely wounded.

On 6 July, armed men attacked a bar and shop located at the centre of Mweya locality, Kirundo-rural zone and Kirundo commune. A customer died on the spot while the owner of the bar was seriously injured. He was reported by local sources to be the main target of this attack because of a land dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: On 6 July, a student from the Murama locality Basic School in Kirundo-rural zone was beaten by a group of Imbonerakure. Worried about his safety, the young student fled to Bujumbura, the capital city.

Non-violent activity: on 6 and 7 July, more than five hundred Burundians were deported from Rwanda, where they had been living for several years. Most of these deportees are from Kirundo province. This incident is likely linked to the diplomatic tensions that exist between the two countries, which accuse each other of harbouring political opponents.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: On 6 July, an employee of the Kabonga Pentecostal church located in Burambira sub-loality of Nyabigina locality, Kabonga zone, was beaten by two young members of the Imbonerakure.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: A student from the University of Burundi was abducted from his home at Gikizi neighbourhood of Kamenge area in Bujumbura by National Intelligence Service (SNR) around 28 June 2018. He was tortured for two weeks before being transferred to the central prison of Mpimba on 12 July 2018. He had been accused of working for the Rwandan intelligence.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 5 July, some Imbonerakure coming from Ruhehe zone armed with Kalshnikov rifles attacked the household of a CNDD-FDD member shopkeeper in Bugabira commune. He was targeted again two days later.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 5 July, some Imbonerakure from the Mpanda communal high school in Bubanza province beat their fellow student who is an FNL member. They accused him of watching them during a party.
On 5 July, a motorcyclist died in an armed attack in Mbizi locality, Kibago zone and commune. Both passengers were currency exchangers and cow sellers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Students (Burundi)
notes: Between 1-7 July, two students were abducted from the University of Burundi, Mutanga campus. They are believed to have been members of the National Forces of Liberation (FNL), one of the parties in Amizero y'Abarundi [Hope for Burundians] opposition coalition.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 2 July, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Bigombo locality, Kirambi zone of Bweru commune, was seriously wounded in the head by young members of the Imbonerakure. These young people from the ruling party accused him of selling a prohibited drink.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 1 July, a member of the FNL party from Rubungu locality in Gikomero zone of Rango commune in Kayanza was beaten with a chain by the zone chief and six other members of the Imbonerakure.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: A member of UPRONA pro-Charles Nditije from Rukambura hill in Butanza area and commune of Kayanza province was shot dead by unknown assailants during the night from 30 June to 1 July 2018. The motive for the attack could not be established.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Burundi)
notes: On 29 June, disabled students staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Solidarity after being exeplled from their dormotories by police in Bujumbura city.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 29 June, the chairman of the National Commission of Lands and Other Goods (CNTB) in Rutana was killed. Other members of the CNDD attempted to poison him before strangling and beating him to death. He was also number 2 of the CNDD-FDD party in Rutana province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Misugi hill in Twinkwavu area of Cendajuru commune in Cankuzo province was shot dead by two young Imbonerakure on 29 June 2018. Local residents also blamed the chief of Misugi for participating in the incident. The motives for the attack are unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: SOBUGEA: Burundian Warehouse Management and Transit Assistance Company
notes: On 29 June, the leader of 'Syndicat des travailleurs de la Societe Burundaise de la Gestion des Entrepots et de l'assistance des Avions en escale (SOBUGEA)' was kidnapped by heavily armed policemen at his home located on 4th Avenue in the Cibitoke neighbourhood and zone in Ntahangwa commune. His relatives indicated that he is detained in the National Intelligence Service (NIS) jail in Rohero zone and no one is allowed to visit him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 June, the leader of the CNDD-FDD party in Gatabo locality and young members of the Imbonerakure from Gatabo zone beat a mason to death in Kayogoro Commune, Makamba. They blamed him for not informing them about his arrival from Gitanga commune in the neighbouring Rutan province. The victim succumbed to the injuries on 29 June.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Around 28 June, an armed group injured three youth members of the Imbonerakure guarding a fence in Nyakazi locality of Kibago commune.

A family from Ngarama Hill in Kayero area of Mpinga-Kayove commune in Rutana province was attacked by a grenade on 28 June 2018. One person was seriously wounded. The family was allegedly attacked due to accusations of witchcraft.

assoc_actor_2: Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: A man from Gihanga commune in Bubanza province was beaten by the local police on 27 June 2018 based on orders from the Gihanga commune administrator's wife. He was then taken to prison. The administrator's wife allegedly wished to discriminate against the victim because he is a Tutsi.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: A man was killed by residents of Masha Hill in Murwi area and commune of Cibitoke province on 27 June 2018. He was reportedly killed after being caught in the act of theft.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A trader married to a FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member of Gihanga commune was beaten, intimidated and robbed of 2 million BIF and a phone by police officers of Rapid Mobile Intervention Group (GMIR) on 26 June 2018. The victim was detained for three nights at the Commissariat of Gihanga and tortured. The assailants reproached him for failing to prevent his wife from campaigning.
On 26 June, an engineer was shot dead by unidentified men in Kibogoye neighbourhood of Muyinga commune and province.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: On 26 June, a member of Provincial Directorate of Agriculture and Livestock who was also an UPRONA member in Muyinga was shot and killed at his house located in the Kizungu neighbourhood of Kibogoye locality in downtown Muyinga.

assoc_actor_2: Twa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: On 26 June, a man from the Twa community in Rwimanzovu locality, Vumbi zone and commune, was murdered by a group of unknown people armed with clubs. The attackers covered him with cassava remnants to make it look like it was related to a theft, but his relatives suspect of targeted murder.
On 26 June, unknown perpetrators set fire to a family home in Sehe locality, Masango zone and Bukinanyana commune. Three members of the family were injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A chief of Musasa area in Kiremba commune of Ngozi province and a local Imbonerakure chief beat up inhabitants of Buhama hill on 26 June 2018. The perpetrators also extorted money from the villagers. One victim was gravely wounded.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A chief of Musasa area in Kiremba commune of Ngozi province and a local Imbonerakure chief beat up inhabitants of Kabanga hill on 26 June 2018. The perpetrators also extorted money from the villagers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A chief of Musasa area in Kiremba commune of Ngozi province and a local Imbonerakure chief beat up inhabitants of Mufigi hill on 26 June 2018. The perpetrators also extorted money from the villagers.

On 25 June, a family from Kigozi locality, Kirundo-rural zone of Kirundo commune was attacked by a grenade by unknown perpetrators. An infant died on the spot while the husband and wife were seriously injured. They were taken to Kirundo hospital. The reasons for this attack are still unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure beat a woman at Buye market on Murinzi Hill of Rutegama commune in Muramvya province on 25 June 2018. He accused her of using the vicitity of the market as a place of worship.The victim was taken to hospital.
On 24 June, one person was killed and 2 others injured in a grenade attack perpetrated on Kirundo hill. Land conflicts were behind the attack.

A man from Kabwira hill in Masabo area of Bugenyuzi commune in Karuzi province was murdered by unknown assailants during the night from 24 to 25 June 2018. He was allegedly killed due to accusations of witchcraft.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi); Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: A student from Great Lakes University of Kiremba in Bururi commune and province was detained and held at a local police station from 24 June 2018, where he was allegedly tortured. The victim was arrested by Transmission Agents (AT) officers following an altercation initiated by the police.

The head of local police in Rutegama of Muramvya province beat and broke the arm of a young man from Rutegama hill and area on 23 June 2018. This policeman reproached the youth for being opposed to his father selling a family estate in secret. The police officer was alerted of the circumstances by the buyer.

On 22 June, a resident from Ruhuma locality, Rugwiza zone in Nyabikere commune was nearly killed by a group of armed men with clubs and knives while he was returning home. His assailants attacked him and started beating him. They fled when they saw a group of Christians coming back from a prayer meeting.
On 22 June, a resident from Bwiza neighborhood and zone of Mukaza commune was beaten before being kidnapped by police officers.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: A man with mental health issues, resident of Bisiga hill in Giteranyi area and commune of Muyinga province was beaten and detained by the local police on 20 June 2018, after they found a photo of general putschist Niyombare in his possession. He was released the following day.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A young man from Mugozi Hill of Bururi area, commune and province was beaten by Imbonerakure youth on 20 June 2018 at a bar. They accused the victim of having insulted the new governor. The young man was seriously wounded.

A family from Masha hill in Murwi area and commune of Cibitoke province was attacked by machetes by a group of unidentified men on 20 June 2018. The mother was seriously wounded. The family was attacked due to accusations of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A barman of Kivoga sub-hill on Kibago hill in Kibago area and commune of Makamba province was beaten by a group of Imbonerakure youth on 20 June 2018. They also extorted a sum of 50,000 BIF from the victim.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
