notes: Imbonerakure youth of Rugarama locality of Makamba area in Makamba commune and province arrested and beat up another Imbonerakure from Kibago commune during the night from 20 to 21 June 2018. The victim was accused of rebellion. He was released the following day.
On 19 June, a sixty-year-old was killed by a grenade on Higiro hill in Gisenyi area of Busoni commune, Kirundo province. Her death was linked to withcraft and land disputes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Nyankara Hill of Nelson area in Makamba commune and province was arrested, tied up and held in detention by a group of Imbonerakure youth from 19 till 20 June 2018. He paid a fine in kind equivalent to 15 000 BIF in order to be released.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teenage girl of Muramvya commune and province was raped by an influential Imbonerakure member on Burambana hill in Muramvya area and commune on 19 June 2018.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: The chief of Musongati locality in Kanyami zone, Kiganda commune, Muramvya province who is also the local leader of the Imbonerakure group was accused of attacking, intimidating and stealing the property of residents.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 17 June, a woman, secretary of the communal committee of the FNL party, living in Muremera locality, Butaganzwa zone, was beaten by members of the Imbonerakure. They asked her to advise her husband to join the CNDD-FDD party if their family wants to live in peace. The victim has filed a complaint but his attackers have not yet been apprehended.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 17 June, a resident of Nyamugari district of the town of Gitega was beaten by Imbonerakure who were doing night patrols.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 17 June, the Imbonerakure beat a person to death elsewhere in Gitega province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 17 June, a person succumbed to his injuries as a result of beatings by a group of Imbonerakure in the night round on Kibimba hill commune and Gitega province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 17 June, the deputy youth leader of Imbonerakure from Marangara zone and commune raped a 15-year-old girl in Burenge locality.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 17 June, a Burundian military personnel was beaten to death by the Imbonerakure in Buhiga commune, Karusi province.
On 16 June, a woman was murdered at her home located in Taba locality, Maramvya zone of Nyabikere commune, Karusi province by unidentified people. Land conflicts seem to be the reason of this murder.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 16 June, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Musema locality, Nyabibuye zone in Butaganzwa commune, was murdered with a machete by a group of 4 members of the Imbonerakure. The perpetrators accused him of having refused to give his contribution to the campaign for the constitutional referendum that was held on May 17th, 2018.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: On 16 June, a former member of the Burundian Armed Forces from Burengo locality, Ruganza zone in Matongo commune, was attacked at his home by the members of the Imbonerakure armed with machetes. They threw stones and tried to force the door of his house. They accused him of giving paramilitary trainings to the opponents. He was safe.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An elderly member of FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa resident of Murambi hill in Gitaba area of Makamba commune and province was beaten by Imbonerakure youth on 16 June 2018. The assailants also stole a sum of 10 000 BIF from him as well as a goat, besides humiliating him in public. The Imbonerakure had allegedly intended to punish the victim for a conflict with a neighbour.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 16 June, groups of Imbonerakure youths in CNDD-FDD party t-shirts carrying sticks chanted songs supporting the power of Nkurunziza in Cankuzo commune.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teenage girl from Gisovu sub-hill of Bubanza commune and province was raped on 16 June 2018 by an Imbonerakure youth. The perpetrator was taken to jail.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 15 June, two men from the localities of Ruhororo and Manga, Jene zone in Kabarore commune, were arrested and beaten by members of the Imbonerakure in Ruhororo locality. They were accused of attempting fraudulent sales of coffee in Rwanda. The administrator of Kabarore commune came to pick them up before taking them to an unknown destination.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A member of FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa party committee of Karuzi province was taken away from his home at Rwingoma hill of Buhiga area and commune to an unknown location by the National Intelligence Service (SNR). The reasons for his abduction/ arrest are unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Burundi)
notes: The leader of Masama hill in Mubavu area of Bweru commune in Ruyigi province tortured a woman by throwing boiling water at her and beating her with clubs in June 2018. The victim had been accused of witchcraft. The assailant disappeared to an unknown location in August 2018 in order to escape the police.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 13 June, two members of the FNL of Agathon Rwasa from village 4 of Gihanga commune in Bubanza Province were arrested by SNR agents. They were shot before being arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Two men were severely beaten by the Imbonerakure before being rescued by the police in Kizuka, Rumonge. Date unclear.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_2: Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: On 13 June, a CNDD-FDD member from Kazirabageni locality and zone, Nyanza-Lac commune beat his wife, accusing her of being a Tutsi ethnic group and refusing to join the presidential party. The woman was injured, while her attacker was arrested and put in the communal jail.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 13 June, an FNL member from Yaranda locality, Kirundo-rural zone of Kirundo commune and province was beaten by two Imbonerakure. These young people of the CNDD-FDD blamed him for being an opponent, before confiscating a sum of 120, 000 BIF.

assoc_actor_2: Refugees/IDPs (Burundi)
notes: The Burundian repatriates from refugee camps in Tanzania were stripped of their possessions at the municipal office of Gisagara in Cankuzo province upon their arrival on 13 June 2018.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A young woman from Nyarurambi hill in Burarana area of Matongo district of Kayanza province was seriously wounded by a machete near her head on 13 June 2018. The assailants were not identified but two Imbonerakure youth are suspected from carrying out the attack.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Burundi)
notes: A farmer from Kigozi hill area of Kirundo commune and province was severely beaten and almost killed by two Imbonerakure youth on 13 June 2018. They reproached him for being a FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member. The victim was left in a coma in the hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure youth attacked, beat up and extorted the sum of 200 000 BIF from another Imbonerakure of Martyazo hill in Gatabo area of Kiganda municipality in Muramvya province on 13 June 2018. They accused him of dissent and distancing himself from the party.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A youth member of Sahwanya FRODEBU party resident in Mutambara hill was beaten by Imbonerakure youth at Gatete hill of Rumonge commune and province on 12 June 2018. The assailants reproached him for being a stranger on the hill. The victim was wounded.

assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 12 June, the leader of the FNL in Kibaya locality, Ndora zone of Bukinanyana commune was abducted at his home by four men in military uniform. His family was later informed that he was detained at the provincial police station. He was released on June 18, reportedly traumatized and tortured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 12 June, an agent of the Family and Community Development Center (CDFC) was beaten in a bar at the center of Murwi commune by a CNDD-FDD member trader who criticized him for having incarcerated for 4 years the executive secretary of the CNDD-FDD in Murwi commune for raping a girl in 2014.
A grenade attack killed two and injured five family members of the local chief on 12 June 2018 in Murwi, Cibitoke province. Accusations of witchcraft and land disputes are behind the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: On 11 June, the body of a policeman was found in a garbage dump with head injuries near the Ntahangwa river in the Nyakabiga area of Mukaza. No reports of clashes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: On 11 June, two women members of the coalition Amizero y'abarundi led by Agathon Rwasa residing in Kizuka zone of Rumonge commune were beaten by young members of the Imbonerakure and a local leader. They were accused of having campaigned for the "No" vote during the referendum poll on May 17.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 11 June, an Imbonerakure from Kagege locality in Mukerwa zone of Busoni Commune, Kirundo Province was murdered. Some local sources speak of dispute settlement among young people of the CNDD-FDD. Five members of the Imbonerakure, who were with the victim during the night patrol, were arrested for questioning and detained in the Busoni police station.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure youth beat a member of FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa of Muzingi hill of Gisanze area in Gashoho commune of Muyinga province on 11 June 2018 and asked him to pay a fine of 2500 BIF for missing a security meeting of the sub-hill.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 10 June, Imbonerakure of Kibingo hill in the Gitaza area in Muhuta commune beat the head of the hill in a bar. These young people in the ruling party accused him of poor governance against the people on his hill.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 10 June, the body of a man was found on Runanira Hill, in the urban center of Kirundo commune and province.He was a teacher and member of the Imbonerakure militia.
On 10 June, a thief was tortured and stoned and another one was seriously injured by the inhabitants of the Caro sub-locality, Buhororo zone, Bubanza commune and province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure youth of Kibingo hill in Gitaza area of Muhuta commune in Rumonge province beat up the leader of this hill in a bar on 10 June 2018. The assailants accused him of bad governance affecting the community of the hill.

One person was killed and twenty others wounded, including four people with serious injuries, by a grenade thrown in front of a shop in the Birohe area of Gitega province on 10 June 2018. The perpetrator is unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 9 June, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Karama locality, Gaheta zone of Rango commune, was beaten by three members of the Imbonerakure. He suffered a broken arm. The perpetrators accused him of voting "no" in the referendum.

assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
notes: On 9 June, the body of a UPD Zigamibanga member was found at Runanira 2 in Kirundo commune and province. According to eyewitnesses, the victim was poisoned.
On 9 June, a man from Gitega province was nearly killed by residents of the Ngoma hill in Musongati commune in Rutana province in a case of popular justice.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 8 June, a man from Kivogero locality, Bukeye zone and commune, who has been detained since May 24th was beaten and robbed by members of the Imbonerakure who accused him of having an extramarital affair with a resident of that locality.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 8 June at the Ryarunyinya hill of the Mubanga area in Ruhororo commune, a man was killed by Imbonerakure. They accused him of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 8 June, members of the Imbonerakure militiamen arrested and tortured a man on Nyabitsinda hill Ruyigi commune and province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure members beat up a man from Muzingi hill of Gisanze area in Gashoho commune in Muyinga province during the night from 8 to 9 June 2018. The assailants accused him of encouraging other community members to vote "No" in the referendum and asked him to pay a fine.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Imbonerakure youth of Giteranyi hill and area in Muyinga province assaulted a former Burundian Armed Forces (ex-FAB) member on 8 June 2018 for criticising the Imbonerakure for extorting money from citizens. The ex-FAB member wanted to retaliate with arms upon returning to camp but others calmed him down.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: On 7 June, unidentified men armed with rifles murdered a taxi-man who was recently retired from the army (ex-FAB) where he was the chief of staff's personal chauffeur. Some sources close to his family point to the agents of the National Intelligence Service (SNR) without giving more details.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 7 June, an Imbonerakure from Burara Hill in the Busoni commune Gatareen area of Kirundo province was assassinated by strangers. This ruling party youth was active in the arrests of opponents.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: The head of Rushubi Hill in Rushubi area in Isare commune of Bujumbura Rural province and two young Imbonerakure beat and tortured a man in the night from 6 to 7 June 2018 as they allegedly witnessed him to commit adultery.
On 6 June, one person was killed (beheaded) by unidentified people in Mugina municipality in Cibitoke province.

On 6 June, a man was abducted by armed men at the small center of the Gasenyi area in Buganda commune of Cibitoke province. The inhabitants suspect Imbonerakure with the complicity of the head of the Gasenyi area.
On 6 June, a young man of the IX district in the Ngagara zone in Ntahangwa commune of the Bujumbura Town Hall, was kidnapped by men in a Jeep. The reasons for this abduction are still unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 5 June, Imbonerakure from Gatagura Hill in the Butanuka area of Mpanda commune in Bubanza province arrested, beat and confiscated the bike of a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member. They blamed him for voting "No" in the last constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure of Musenyi area in Mpanda municipality of Bubanza Province erected a barrier on Nationale 9 Road between Bujumbura and Bubanzale on 5 June 2018 in order to oblige all passers-by to participate in communal works near Mpanda municipal office. Those who were not able to participate had to donate money instead.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Young Imbonerakure of Mukike commune in Bujumbura Rural province staged a protest on 5 June 2018 against the selection of former protesters and civil society activists for training in Gitega province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Rwibikara hill in Gasenyi zone of Busoni commune, Kirundo province was beaten by Imbonerakure youth on 5 June 2018 on pretext of refusing to tell the perpetrators whether he had voted in the last referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from the Nyamabere hill of Musenyi area in Mpanda commune of Bubanza province was sentenced to death on 5 June 2018 by a local Imbonerakure leader. The victim was sentenced on pretext of having alerted the police when the Imbonerakure were about to murder a young man who was barely saved.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 4 June, three young Imbonerakure from Kiranda Hill in Lazare and Bugenyuzi commune in Karusi province raped a girl in Kwigamba.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: On 3 June, an ex-FAB member was abducted in Rukeco, Busiga commune, Ngozi province. His family fears he was kidnapped by the Burundian secret service but this was not confirmed.

On 3 June 2018, three people were killed in Gitaramuka Hill, Burambira commune, Gashoho area of Muyinga province by unidentified men armed with machetes and knives. Claims of witchcraft and a land dispute are linked to their deaths.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: The head of CNDD-FDD party committee of Gitaramuka hill and commune in Karuzi province attempted to rape a woman on 3 June 2018. The woman managed to escape.

notes: Members of the CNDD-FDD party of Cankuzo commune in Cankuzo province staged a demonstratrion on 2 June 2018. assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Members of the CNDD-FDD party of Rugombo commune in Cibitoke province staged a demonstratrion on 2 June 2018 in Cibitoke. notes: On 2 June, hundreds of members of the CNDD-FDD party of Mabanda commune in Makamba province held a demonstration march against France's declarations on the constitutional referendum in Burundi and the proposal of the special envoy of the UN General Secretary in Burundi on the Burundian crisis.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Members of the CNDD-FDD party of Muramvya commune and province staged a demonstratrion on 2 June 2018 in Muramvya. actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: A woman was abducted by National Intelligence Service (SNR) agents at her home in Bukirasazi district in Kinama area of Ntahangwa municipality of Bujumbura, likely due to the fact that her husband is an exiled member of CNDD-FDD. She was released from SNR prison on 13 June 2018, having suffered torture.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Non-violent activity: On 1 June, following an attack in Bugendana the night before, gunfire heard as police and military forces search for the attackers. It is unclear if there was an exchange of fire between the two groups.
On 31 May, three thieves were beaten to death by residents of Masasi locality, located in the centre of Gasorwe commune, Muyinga. Two others were seriously injured. No one was arrested.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 31 May, a Burundi citizen went missing after he was last seen being arrested by SNR agents and Imbonerakure in Ngozi town.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 31 May, armed men in military uniform engaged in a firefight in Mirama locality, Mugera zone and Bugendana commune. One person was killed, and four others were seriously injured. The attackers took money from people who were at a nearby pub, as well as from the households of this locality. One of the victims was an Imbonerakure student.

Movement of forces: on 30 May, twelve heavily armed men in military uniform were seen patrolling by Rugaragara locality in Nyabitsinda zone and commune. This created a panic among the residents of this commune.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 30 May, a man from Mukiga sub-locality in Bumba locality, Cankuzo, accused of complicity in robbery was beaten by the Imbonerakure until his right arm was broken before being driven prison.
Around the 27 May - 2 June week, three people were lynched in Gasorwe commune. Another 3 were lynched on 31 May in Masasi locality of Gasorwe.

On 29 May, residents of Mukiga sub-locality in Bumba locality killed a man that was caught burgling from a household. This incident came after recent remarks made by the governor of Cankuzo province and the deputy commissioner of the judicial police who said that it is normal for the population to kill a thief caught in an obvious offence.

On 28 May, the lifeless body of a two-year-old boy was found in Nyakigina locality, Nyabitanga zone and Gishubi commune. His head, arms and legs had been taken by his attackers. He had been missing for more than three months.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: On 28 May, a woman in her fifties who is a member of UPRONA pro Charles Nditije was found dead in her shop in Runda locality of Nyamugari zone, Marangara commune. The victim was raped and strangled with a rope by her attackers. Five men from the area were arrested by the police for questioning.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 27 May, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Mufumya locality, Butaganzwa zone and commune, Kayanza was killed with a machete by a group of armed men.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 27 May, two people who are members of Amizero y Aburundi, were arrested and seriously beaten by Imbonerakure in Gitanga hill in Gashikanwa commune in Ngozi province for not applauding when the name of the President was quoted in a meeting.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 26 May, an Imbonerakure was wounded in a clash between members of the Imbonerakure and police officers in Rukago locality, Gahombo zone, Kayanza.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 26 May, the Kiyange district chief in the Buterere area disappeared without trace. He was last seen in the hands of SNR agents.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 26 May, about 90 Imbonerakure members from Cankuzo held a protest march in Cankuzo to celebrate the "Yes" vote in the constitutional referendum on 17 May.
On 25 May, two bodies were found in the Kamaramagambo locality and zone in Butihinda commune. A land dispute is believed to be the reason for the deaths.
On 25 May, a motorcyclist was seriously beaten and put in prison by the commune administrator and a policeman in Masha locality, Murwi zone, Cibitoke. They accused him of possessing grenades.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 25 May, a man from Mungwa zone, Gitega commune and province was beaten by an Imbonerakure for allegedly declaring that Rwasa will win the 2020 elections.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 25 May, a policeman accompanied by Imbonerakure was shot and severely wounded in Kigamba locality, Nyabitare zone, Ruyigi.

On 24 May, a policeman from Magara police station in Bugarama commune shot and wounded a young girl detained in the communal jail. He was trying to rape the victim when she managed to escape. That's when the police officer shot her.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 23 May, three young members of the Imbonerakure from Muzye locality and zone of Giharo commune abducted an agent of the Amizero y'Abarundi Coalition to an unknown location.

On 23 May, a group of five men armed with two guns and dressed in white robes with balaclavas, attacked a bar located in the Burasira locality, Muramba zone of Mugamba commune. The assailants killed an elderly person who tried to escape after refusing their order to kneel like the others. They also took 90,000 BIF from the victims after beating them.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 22 May, an FNL member of the Amizero y Aburundi coalition was seriously beaten by Imbonerakure youth in the Gatumba area of Mutimbuzi commune, Bujumbura province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 22 May, two FNL members were beaten by a group of Imbonerakure from Gasave locality of Ntega zone and commune. The victims were blamed for voting "No" during the referendum. The local leader of the CNDD-FDD party sanctioned them a fine of 15,000 BIF in order to settle the case.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 22 May, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL and Amizero y Abarundi Coalition member from Nyagahanda locality, Nyabitsinda zone and commune in Ruyigi province went missing after he was arrested and beaten by two young members of the Imbonerakure.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: On 21 May, a catechiste of the paroisse parish was killed by unidentified armed men in Gitega.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 21 May, a CNDD-FDD member was seriously wounded by a grenade on Buhoro Hill, Bwambarangwe Commune, Kirundo Province by suspected Imbonerakure.

Non-violent activity: on 21 May, the Independent National Electoral Commission (CENI) announced the provisional results of the Constitutional Referendum on 17 May in which 73.6% of votes were casted for "Yes". This will effectively allow President Nkurunziza to hold office until 2034.

On 21 May, a 50-year-old from Kaniha locality in Mugera zone of Mishiha commune was killed with clubs by her neighbor. The abuser accused the victim of being a witch. He was arrested and taken to the communal police prison.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 21 May, a motorcylist who is a member of the FNL pro Agathon Rwasa from Muzye locality, Muzye zone of Giharo commune in Rutana province was beaten and threatened with death by an Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 20 May, four members of the Amizero y Aburundi coalition were beaten and had their possessions stolen by members of the CNDD-FDD Imbonerakure in the Gihogazi commune of Karusi province.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: On 20 May, a priest narrowly escaped an assassination attempt in Mbogora parish in Nyabihanga commune, Mwaro province when unidentified people shot at him. He was injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A few days before a grenade attack on a CNDD-FDD member in Buhoro hill, Kirundo, on 21 May, he was beaten up in a bistro by an Imbonerakure member for his political ideology.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 19 May, clashes were reported in Nyamitanga in Cibitoke between regular army units supported by Imbonerakure and an armed group from Democratic Republic of Congo.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 18 May, a member of the Amizero y Aburundi coalition who is a resident of Gihogazi in Karusi commune was arrested and beaten. The source did not specify whether police or Imbonerakure were involved.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 18 May, two members of the Amizero y Aburundi coalition were arrested in the Kinyami district, Ngozi commune and province by the head of the SNR in Ngozi and Imbonerakure members. They were tortured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 18 May, A pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Kibande Hill in Butihinda commune in Muyinga province was hit hard by the hill chief and Imbonerkaure youth leader. He had complained about the destruction of his cassava field by Imbonerakure who criticized him for having voted "No" in the referendum vote.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 17 May, at the Butembu Basic School in Butanuka zone, Mpanda commune of Bubanza, four people accused of voting "No" were abducted and taken to a banana plantation where they were tortured by the ruling party's young militia and fined a sum of 10,000 BIF.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: Around 17 May in Mpanda commune, Bubanza, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from the nearby Nyomvyi locality who had come to see one of the agents of the Coalition of Independents Amizero y'Abarundi was beaten by the Imbonerakure for his political affiliation and demanded a fine of 20,000 BIF. Among the victims of the Imbonerakure is a man from Cibitoke province, who was tied and tortured.
On 16 May, a grenade exploded in Bururi province without causing any casualties.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: Around 16 May, CNDD-FDD Imbonerakure youth imposed a 10pm curfew on University of Burundi students, particularly in the Mutanga campus. They reportedly beat students who break the curfew.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Non-violent activity: on 15 May, CNDD-FDD party officials were reported to have distributed arms to Imbonerakure youth in the Gatumba area of Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura.

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Burundi)
notes: On 14 May, 7 dead bodies were found floating on the Rusizi river near a bridge that leads to Gatumba. The bodies had been tied up together. Three of the bodies wore military uniform, four of the bodies had civilian clothing. Date and circumstances unclear.

On 13 May, a man died after a grenade exploded in his house in Kavomo hill in Kirundo commune and Province by unidentified individuals. It is suspected that they were targeted due to accusations of witchcraft.
On 13 May in Buhoro hill in Bwambarangwe commune, a grenade targeted the home of a CNDD-FDD party official. No damage or injury reported.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 13 May, an FNL member of the Amizero y Abarundi coalition was beaten to death with sticks by the vice-president of the Imbonerakure youth league in Ntega commune of Kirundo province. 12 others reported seriously injured and 4 missing.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: On 11 May, a youth representative of the Sahwanya Frodebu party in Nyabugete in the Kanyosha zone of Bujumbura Mairie went missing after being arrested by members of the National Intelligence Service.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
notes: On 11 May, thirty to fourty armed men with rifles and knives killed 26 people and set fire to buildings in Ruhagarika village in Cibitoke province. The identity of the attackers is unknown, though they are reported to have come from the Democratic Republic of Congo.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 11 May, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL party committee member from the Gihanga Commune in Bubanza Province and the Coalition of Independent Peoples of Hope was beaten and extorted of money by young Imbonerakure from Village VI Gihanga. They accused him of disrupting security while he was campainging for "No" in the constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: On 9 May, a trader from the Rwibaga center in the Jenda area of Mugongo-Manga commune in the Bujumbura-rural province was beaten by three Imbonerakure and a policeman. They asked him to show his map of voters that he did not have on him and started beating him before the policeman joined them.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 8 May, three Ruzingati Imbonerakure in Gahombo commune knifed a man. They assaulted him after accusing him of going for a walk without the National Identity Card (NIC). The three youths in the ruling party were arrested and put in jail in Gahombo commune. The victim was brought to the Gahombo Health Center.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: Between 1-17 May, a member of the Amizero y Aburundi coalition was killed in Gitega province by Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 7 May, the population of Kanyosha zone, Bujumbura was seriously beaten by CNDD-FDD Imbonerakure who wanted to take them by force to a referendum rally.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 7 May, two pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL members from Rusagara Hill in the Kigamba area and Kigamba commune in Cankuzo Province were beaten by members of the CNDD-FDD party at a bar. They were returning from the "No" meeting to the constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: On 6 May, a student in Mutanga campus was beaten by more than 20 CNDD-FDD Imbonerakure armed with clubs. Other students reported torture.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 6 May, a psycho-social assistant of the Center for Family and Community Development (CDFC) in the chief town of Mabayi commune in Cibitoke province was beaten by an Imbonerakure who is also a member of the National Intelligence Service (SNR). He was beaten for wanting to vote "No" to the constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 6 May, an FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa member on Nyabibuye hill in Kayanza province was beaten by two Imbonerakure. He was accused of having said Agathon Rwasa.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 6 May, three police officers and five Imbonerakure fought each in the capital of Cendajuru Commune in Cankuzo Province. Policemen were closing the bistros and these young people of the ruling party have tried to prevent them.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 5 May, a man was arrested and beaten with iron wires by CNDD-FDD Imbonerakure on his way home from Bueheka in Nyanza-Lac commune, Makamba. Another man was also seriously beaten on the same hill in Buheka.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 5 May, an FNL pro Agathon Rwasa member of the Kigomero hill in the area and Tangang commune in Ngozi province was tied up and beaten by Imbonerakure.

assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: On 5 May, an activist from the Coalition of Independents of Hope (Amizero y Aburundi) in Mayanza Hill, Kinyinya area and commune in Ruyigi province was beaten by Imbonerakure. He was blamed for daring to vote "No" in the referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 5 May, an Imbonerakure in Runyeri Hill in the Bitare area in Bugendana commune of Gitega province beat a woman member of his party. He beat her for cutting her field instead of listening to the teachings on the voting procedures.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 4 May, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member and supporter of the Coalition of Independent of Hope was beaten by the Gasave hill chief and Imbonerakure in the Ntega district and commune of Kirundo province. They accused him of having openly declared that he would vote "No" in the referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 4 May, a resident of Rukere Hill in Jene Zone in Kabarore Commune of Kayanza Province was arrested, tied up and beaten by Imbonerakure youths in the commune jail.

assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 3 May, an FNL party member who is part of the Amizero Y'Abarundi coalition was kidnapped by Imbonerakure and National Intelligence Service from Kanyosha commune.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: Around 3 May, a man was beaten to death by Imbonerakure youth of the ruling party in the presence of some hill elected officials. The attack took place at Kibimba hill in Giheta commune of Gitega Province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 3 May, a former pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was beaten in Muhanga commune, Kayanza Province as he was returning home by a group of young Imbonerakure led by the head of the CNDD-FDD party in the Muramvya area. He was accused of teaching people to vote "No" to the constitutional referendum.
After a man was killed by Imbonerakure, inhabitants of the locality besieged the communal office of Giheta to claim that the culprits be punished according to the law.
From 2-3 May, two CNDD-FDD party flags were burned in front of the party headquarters in Ngozi commune.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 2 May, members of the FNL pro-Agathon Rwasa party in Rango commune of Kayanza province were beaten by Imboneraure with sticks at the capital of the commune near the market of Rangopar. They were returning from a meeting with Coalition of Independents of Hope (Mizero y'Abarundi) in Ngozi.
On 1 May, in Kanyosha commune in Bujumbura-Rural, two monuments of the presidential party were ransacked.
On 1 May, two people were killed and five wounded in a grenade attack in the village of Kabuyenge in Gisuru district, Ruyigi.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Property destruction: property belonging to a man with links to the CNDD-FDD party in Ruzingati in the Gahombo area and commune in Kayanza province was destroyed by unknown people.
On 1 May, policemen providing security at the Lycee Scheppers of Nyakabiga in Bujumbura-Mairie beat the workers who tried to return before the end of the ceremonies of the Labor.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 1 May, the youth leader of Imbonerakure on Ruhororo hill in Jene area in Kabarore commune of Kayanza province attacked a FNL pro Agathon Rwasa member.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: On 1 May, a man from the Nabubu sub-hill on Shari Hill in the area, commune and Bubanza province was beaten by a young group Imbonerakure who were on a night patrol. They drove him to an uninhabited house and started beating him.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-); FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 30 April, a soldier from the former FNL movement disappeared from Muzinda in Bubanza province. It was not confirmed if he was abducted but his political affiliation suggests he was target for opposition to the referendum.
On 30 April, 15 people were injured in a grenade attack on Karurusi hill in Gatara commune, Kayanza. Two people, including a soldier were arrested.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 30 April, a soldier was beaten and disarmed by Imbonerakure members in Rutongo area, Muhuta commune.
On 29 April, the head of the Kanyosha police station arrested and beat up a youg man and a girl from Ruyaga locality. The young man had refused to show his identity card.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: On 29 April, a young UPRONA member in Bugendana IDP camp was beaten by Imbonerakure members.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 29 April, a man was stabbed in the face by young members of the Imbonerakure in Cumba locality, Rutegama commune. The victim was accused of breaking the curfew.
On 28 April, a dozen armed men in military uniform arrested and beat a man in Ruzingati locality, Gahombo commune, Kayanza.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: On 28 April, four students were seriously beaten by a group of Imbonerakure on the Mutanga campus. The Imbonerakure said the students did not have reason to be in the campus. They were given to security forces who detained them.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 April, members of the Imbonerakure held a public demonstration in Rohero zone, Mukaza commune, Bujumbura Mairie. They chanted support for President Nkurunziza.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 April, the lifeless body of a young Imbonerakure was found on the Nyabuhira River from Butamuheba Hill in the Mungwa area in Gitega commune and province.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 April, CNDD-FDD members most composed of Imbonerakure held a demonstration in Kirundo. They chanted "we must consolidate our strength because the 'putschist' general Niyombare has gone crazy."
Non-violent activity: on 27 April, a soldier who extorted miners fired his rifle in the air after they had tried to resist him in Cunyu locality, Gasneyi zone, Buganda commune of Cibitoke.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 27 April, a pro-Rwasa Agathon FNL activist was beaten with sticks by five Imbonerakure in Kiramahira locality of Rango zone. They blamed him for saying a "yes" vote in the referendum would cause the nation to "disappear".

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 27 April, a pro-Rwasa Agathon FNL activist was beaten by two Imbonerakure in Rango commune, Kayanza. He was beaten until he vomitted blood after speaking against the referendum.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 27 April, a young member of the Imbonerakure went missing. His body was found on 28 April in the Butamuheba locality, Mungwa zone, Gitega commune with knife wounds.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 27 April, a resident in the Murwi commune of Cibitoke was tortured in his home by four Imbonerakure members for not paying a debt to another resident.

assoc_actor_1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
notes: On 27 April, a Metallubia Company employee was abudcted by three men - two in police uniform and one in civilian clothing from Ntahangwa commune, Bujumbura Mairie.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 27 April, a man residing on Kinama Hill in the Gisuru area and commune of Ruyigi Province was beaten and wounded in the head with a machete by Imbonerakure for making a prohibited drink.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 26 April, a grenade was thrown at the house of a CNDD-FDD member in Gacokwe locality, Ndemeka zone, Gisuru commune, Ruyigi. Only the gate was damaged.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 26 April, two men were arrested and beaten in Kizuka locality of Rumonge commune and province by young Imbonerakure. They were accused of campaigning for the "No" vote in the referendum.

notes: On 26 April, one Imbonerakure wounded another Imbonerakure with a machete in Buhiga Hospital, Karusi Province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 25 April, a man from Rukere Hill in the Jene Zone, Kabarore in Kayanza Province was beaten by young Imbonerakure. They blamed him for trying to run his palm oil in Rwanda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: In the week of 22-28 April, Imbonerakure students at Musema High School in Kayanza Province beat some their classmates when they forcibly collected money for election contributions.
On 25 April, men armed with clubs attacked a family in Mahande, Murwi commune of Cibitoke. The motive was connected to withcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 24 April, a woman from Kayunga village in Kiyonza area in Bugabira commune of Kirundo province was beaten by young Imbonerakure. They accused her of exceeding the curfew.

On 24 April, the body of two men and one woman were removed from Kanyaru river in Kinyovu locality, Mugendo zone, Ntega commune. Their hands were tied behind their backs.
On 22 April, a grenade was thrown in a bar in the Nyakibingo area of Gitega province. Light damage reported but no deaths or injuries.

notes: On 22 April, a police officer fired two shots at a group of Imbonerakure in Nyakibingo locality, Ntega commune, Kirundo. No exchange of fire was reported.
On 22 April, three dead bodies were found floating on the Kanyaru River in Ntega commune of Kirundo province. They had been tied up and were recovered by Imbonerakure members.

On 7 April, a grenade was thrown in a cafeteria in Ceru-Gitamo locality, Gitega-rural zone and Gitega commune. No damage was reported.
On 7 April, three construction workers were seriously injured after a grenade exploded at a construction site in Gasenyi zone, Buganda commune, Cibitoke.

Arrests: On 7 April, law enforcement officers checked the registers of different households on 12th, 13th and 14th Avenue in Cibitoke zone, Ntahangwa commune. Twenty-five people were arrested in this operation but only two were taken to prison. The rest were released on the way after paying a sum ranging from 5,000 and 10,000 BIF.

notes: On 7 April, three members of the Imbonerakure from Nyarusange locality, Rango commune, broke a man's arm. They beat him for saying that he will not participate in the upcoming referendum.

On 5 April, the body of a woman was found in Kirama locality of Mudende zone, Buyengero commune. She had stick marks on her body and locals believe she was the victim of mob justice following a land dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: On 17 March, around 300 members of the CNDD-FDD party in Kirundo demonstrated against "false" reports of UN experts on human rights in the country. Protesters were surrounded by police who secured the procession but did not engage.

notes: On 17 March, CNDD-FDD members in Kayanza held a demonstration march against reports by UN experts on human rights violations in Burundi.

notes: On 15 March, a soldier beat a former soldier to death at a roadblock near Kivoga.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 14 March, a Burundian man who refused to register to vote was beaten, tortured and hospitalised. He died on 18 March. He had been arrested by Imbonerakure in the Cendajuru commune. On the same day (14 March), Imbonerakure also beat a man who was returning from a bar he owns in Cendajuru in Cankuzo for being out after curfew.
On 13 March, the dead body of a man was found at the Rwaba river bank on Mugerama hill in the Nyanza-Lac area and commune in Makamba province. He went missing two days earlier.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: In the night from 11-12 March, more than a dozen young Imbonerakure from Murama Hill in the Kirundo-rural area in Kirundo commune attacked the family of a woman member of the UPRONA pro Charles Nditije. They destroyed property but no injuries were reported.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 12 March, nine young men from the Kiyonza area in Bugabira commune of Kirundo province were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure. They are accused of wanting to join a rebel movement based in Rwanda. They were taken to the SNR prison in Kirundo.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 12 March, a young man from Musagara Hill was beaten by young Imbonerakure. He was blamed for insulting them and was beaten as he opposed the exploitation of family land.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 12 March, a young man from the Muzye area in Giharo commune of Rutana province was beaten by a group of five Imbonerakure on the orders of the party leader. The party hit him stealing 20,000 BIF so that this party leader would sell him his plot.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: On 12 March, a FRODEBU Nyakuri party member from Rukago Hill in the Gahombo area was beaten by an Imbonerakure.
On 10 March, a body was found on Nyamirambo hill, in Masango. The killers and date of death are unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 10 March, an FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Bihanga. This FNL Rwasa is frequently targeted because he refuses to support the CNDD-FDD.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 9 March, 10 Imbonerakure abducted a man from his house and took him to the nearby Nyakabanda River, where they tortured him. They accused him of stealing.
On 9 March, a man accused of witchcraft was beaten by his neighbours and family members. He escaped death by fleeing into the nearby lake.

assoc_actor_1: Batwa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: On 9 March, Twa residents of Jimbi held a sit-in outside the jail to protest the death of a visiting Twa woman.
On 9 March, a body in a state of decomposition was found near the Kabirizi Lake in Bubanza. The date of the killing and the attackers are unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 8 March, Imbonerakure beat 2 FNL Rwasa supporters, who were accused of planning a campaign against the referendum no vote.
