assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: On 8 March, the head of the Imbonerakure in Kibago beat an FNL Rwasa supporter. The FNL Rwasa supporter could not provide proof that he had paid the provincial building tax, so the Imbonerakure accused him of being a 2015 troublemaker.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 8 March, 2 Imbonerakure beat a man for more than two hours in Karinzi. They were angry with the man for not providing them with money for drinks.

assoc_actor_1: Batwa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: On 8 March, Twa residents of Jimbi held a sit-in outside the jail to protest the death of a visiting Twa woman.

assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: On 7 March, a Twa communal woman from Mubuga in Ngozi, was found dead in Jimbi. She had visited a relative in Jimbi and been arrested for not carrying her national ID card. The community in Jimbi believed that she was killed while under arrest and then her body was dumped in the neighbourhood.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 5 March, Imbonerakure beat the wife and daughter-in-law of a man they arrested in Burambana Hill in Muramvya district.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 5 March, 8 Imbonerakure beat a man in a bar in Nyabisaka. They extorted BIF27,000 out of the man.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 4 March, Imbonerakure on a patrol in Buhiga beat a hill councillor. They accused him of disobedience to the ruling party.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: On 4 March, Imbonerakure beat a Batwa man in Murwi. They accused him of practising witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 Feb, the head of the Gitaramuka Imbonerakure beat a teacher for criticising the ruling party.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 Feb, Imbonerakure beat a man in Rwibikara. He was accused of saying that he would vote no in the constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 27 February, a Muyinga resident was hit by an Imbonerakure after he was overheard saying he would vote no to the constitutional revision. He was arrested and spent three days in prison.
On 27 Feb, a man was attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in Murehe, in Minyare.
On 27 Feb, a person accused of robbery was attacked and killed by a mob of people in Kigutu.
On 27 Feb, a mob in Kigwena beat an accused thief to death.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 26 Feb, the body of a young man who had been killed by Imbonerakure, was found in Gatete. The victim had been in the Mahama refugee camp in Rwanda, but returned to visit his family in Gatete and was arrested by Imbonerakure at the border.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 26 Feb, Imbonerakure beat a man on Ntunda hill. They accused him of saying that he had worked for the General Niyombare. The head of the hill made the man pay a BIF13,000 fine.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A senior CNDD-FDD official was shot when a group of military officers raided a bar in Mutoyi. He refused to obey the military officers so they fired 15 bullets at him, killing him.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 26 Feb, 3 unidentified assailants armed with machetes attacked an Imbonerakure in Kabere. He was seriously injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Karinzi was beaten by Imbonerakure, who overheard him openly criticise the regime. He was also forced to pay a BIF30,000 fine.
On 25 February, a grenade was thrown at a main road called Kurya Kanyoni in Cibitoke Zone. Three people were seriously injured.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure held a demonstration march around different neighbourhoods of Mwakiro, to declare that no one will dislodge the CNDD-FDD from power.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten with sticks by Imbonerakure, who were conducting a house to house check of voter registrations. When they discovered that he had not registered, they beat him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter in Gahise, Butaganzwa, was beaten to death. The man's wife and neighbours believe that the murder was committed by Imbonerakure during a voter registration check.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: Clashes broke out between tea growers of Nyamurenge hill, in Makamba, and the police and SNR. The police interfered with trucks from a tea factory to force them to reload the tea onto the Burundi Tea Board vehicles (the farmers are resisting selling their tea to the Burundi Tea Board). 2 farmers were arrested in the riot.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure strangled a man to force him to vote yes in the constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Herders (Burundi)
notes: A cowherder in Mitakataka was beaten by Imbonerakure because his cows got in the way of the presidential motorcade.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: When the presidential motorcade passed through Gifurwe, Imbonerakure beat a man who did not get far enough off the road, and the police arrested a man who tried to cross the road on his motorcycle.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure carried out a voter registration check on Teme hill. People without voter registration proof were beaten and fined BIF250-500.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Munazi began a campaign where anyone who had not registered to vote would receive 40 lashes (30 for females). It is unknown how many people have been punished in this way.
Tea growers and police clashed in Kiyege, Rusaka, when the police tried to force the tea growers to sell their tea to the Burundi Tea Board.
2 people were killed in a grenade attack on the Muhenga hill in Buvyuko. It is believed that land disputes were the source of conflict.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Gitsiro, in Vyanda, carried out a voter registration check. Everyone was required to produce proof that they had registered to vote. Those who had not were beaten and harrassed.
On 19 February, a man was tortured by police forces using burning rubber in Murengeza, Mpanda commune in Bubanza province.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade on Murambi hill, in Gitaba. One woman was killed and one was seriously injured. It is believed that the attack was because of witchcraft.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Arrests: Police and military carried out a household search in Musaga on 19/2. More than 200 people were arrested and forced to pay to be released.
A grenade exploded in the Kiranira section of the Musaga neighbourhood.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 4 youths from Bujumbura attempted to cross into Rwanda. They were turned back by the Rwandan border guards and then arrested by the SNR. The SNR held and tortured them in their offices leaving two allegely in a bad health situation, and then handed them to the police, who are still holding them in custody.
A group of people in the Musenyi part of Tangara stoned and beat a man in his house who was accused of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Gihanga hold nightly patrols where they beat anyone who is out after the curfew. Start date unclear - report dated 01/03.

25 policemen carried out voter reigstration checks in Makamba. Citizens without registration slips were marched to the registration centre, to be forced to register. A policeman used a rope to beat people who had not registered.

assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: The body of a Twa man, who had been tied up and killed, was found in the Taba marsh in Maramvya.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter from Rukago was picked up by Imbonerakure and brought to the CNDD FDD headquarters, where he was tortured. The CNDD-FDD wanted to punish him for saying publicly that no one should be forced to register to vote.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 Imbonerakure went from household to household in Gihanga, checking that everyone had registered to vote. They beat a youth who could not produce proof of registration.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 men travelling through Kayero on their way to work were intercepted by Imbonerakure conducting a voter registration check. When they admitted that they had forgotten their registration slips, they were arrested and beaten.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: On 14 February, local authorities in Cendajuru commune (Cankuzo province), beat a man with an iron bar because he refused to register to vote. He later died in hospital on 18 March due to beatings he suffered during detention.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Teachers at the Nzewe School in Rukago were beaten with sticks and batons by 2 Imbonerakure because they did not have proof of voter registration.
A man driving home in Kibenga was shot dead by unidentified attackers.
Residents on Mungwa hill, in Ruramba attacked a family accused of witchcraft. They tied the wife, husband, and son up and beat them. Then they lynched the husband.
A grenade was thrown at the Wallis Centre in Musaga by unidentified attackers. There were no injuries.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A FRODEBU supporter in Murwi was beaten by an Imbonerakure for failing to register to vote.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Property destruction: On 13 February, five Imbonerakure destroyed the house of a resident of Rutamba Hill in the Muzye area in Giharo commune of Rutana province. They accuse the resident of ignoring a call to join the CNDD-FDD party.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Gihanga carried out a voter registration campaign. They closed markets and daily activities and beat anyone who could not produce a voter registration slip.

Hundreds of people from Ngoma held a sit-in in front of the office of the Murwi administrator on the week of 12 February to protest the administrator's decision to demolish houses following a property dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Bugabira carried out a voter registration campaign. They moved through the streets with clubs checking every person's registration number. The people who did not have registration numbers were taken to a nearby hill and made to lie on their stomachs, where the Imbonerakure beat them.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A seasonal worker who had returned home to Karinzi was beaten by Imbonerakure, when someone reported that he had said that the constitutional referendum would not solve Burundi's problems.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure carried out a voter registration exercise in Buhiga. All passers-by on the Buhiga National Road had to produce proof that they had registered to vote in order to continue along the road. All markets were ordered closed, and all shoppers and stall keepers were asked for proof of registration. People who resisted the Imbonerakure at the road block or in the market were beaten.
A grenade was thrown into the crowd in a part of Kinanira commonly known as Chechnya. 11 people were injured. The police do not know who the attackers were.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Bugarama was beaten and then arrested by Imbonerakure, who overheard him saying that he would not vote in the constitutional referendum.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Supporters of the ruling party protested against the UN report on Burundi in the streets of the capital city.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: An ex-FAB was kidnapped by the National Intelligence Service near Musaga. He was tortured.
2 men were killed by unidentified attackers near Buganda and dumped in the Rusizi river. The bodies then disappeared. The residents suspect that the police disposed of them to hide the evidence.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa leader in Mwaro, Nyabihanga, was attacked and beaten up by Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A member of the Nyamwera hill council, in Maramvya area was seriously injured when the Imbonerakure chief attacked him with a knife. Imbonerakure also conducted a registration campaign in Maramvya. They closed down all shops and trading points and ordered everyone to register for the referendum. Anyone who failed to comply was beaten.
A couple were injured in a grenade attack on their home. The husband died from his injuries. Neighbours believe that they were attacked in a land dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: The local Imbonerakure leader beat students at the Gihanga Communal High School. He accused them of being loyal to FNL Rwasa.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from the Murama locality in Nyabihanga Commune of Mwaro Province was seriously injured by an Imbonerakure youth leader on Thursday, February 8th. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the Nyabihanga police station before being relieved for a few moments after members of the ruling party pressured police.

An unidentified individual threw a grenade around 8:20pm in the courtyard of the bus station. This information has been confirmed by the police, who indicated that the explosion broke the window of a trailer truck. A second grenade that did not explode was defused. Some people in the area were arrested for questioning.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Burundi (2005-)
notes: The chief of the Kirundo rural district and province was attacked by unidentified individuals in Kavomo. 2 men threw a grenade at his motorcycle, which wounded his leg. They pursued him with guns, but did not catch him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The head of the Imbonerakure in Gatete beat an MSD supporter with a stick in the Gatete jail. The MSD supporter is accused of failing to pay a debt, however, his family believes that he was targeted because he is an MSD supporter. The victim was severely injured and has been hospitalised.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A young man who runs a restaurant in Gihogazi locality, zone and commune was beaten Tuesday, February 6th by Imbonerakure led by their leader in this locality.

Three people, two men and a woman, from the Buzige locality in Ruyaga zone of Kanyosha commune, were arrested, beaten and stripped of all their possessions by a group of four men armed with guns around 8:30 pm on Tuesday, February 6th. As these three people were going back home, the assailants in civilian clothes arrested and beat them. They kept them for almost an hour before letting them go

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure youth in Buhayira. He was accused of calling people to vote no in the referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A young FNL Rwasa supporter was abducted by 5 Imbonerakure. They beat him severely and then took him away. The villagers believe that his body was thrown in the river. The Imbonerakure have told the villagers that he fled to Rwanda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A young FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in Ruyaga. The Imbonerakure are angry with this youth because he refuses to join the CNDD-FDD.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A former FAB in Jimbi asked the Imbonerakure leader to move his cow from the communal field. The Imbonerakure beat him and then held him in the jail.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by 2 Imbonerakure youth in Ruyaga.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was strangled by unidentified attackers in his home on Nkago hill, in Butaganzwa.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: More than a hundred Imbonerakure gathered in Mishiha. They protested outside the houses of people known to be anti CNDD-FDD and threatened them with violence.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Kiyove, in Masango, was beaten and arrested by 2 imbonerakure. They accused him of illegally owning a grenade. The man claims that the Imbonerakure planted the grenade in his house during the search.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was attacked and beaten by Imbonerakure in his home in the Gikomero area. They accused him of telling people to vote no in the referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 2 February, an FNL member was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure in front of his wife and children because he was suspected of telling people to vote 'no' in the constitutional vote.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat and arrested a group of young men in Rweza. The men were officially accused of cultivating cannabis, but their families believe that they have been arrested because they refused to participate in ruling party activities.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: At the end of January, a Muyinga driver was beaten by the zone chief and Imbonerakure at a roadblock after he failed to produce a receipt of registration for the vote.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: Military forces and FNL fighters clashed in the Rukoko forest. 2 soldiers and an FNL were killed and many others were injured.
A girl who was visiting Gitanga went missing. Her body was discovered 8 days later.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: A member of UPRONA in Butaganzwa was killed by Imbonerakure over a land dispute.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A former FAB member was killed by unidentified attackers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 4 Imbonerakure beat a man to death and threw his body into a marsh. He was accused of stealing.
A man in Ngagara was killed by unidentified attackers
3 men armed with machetes beheaded a trader as he travelled to Gasenyi, near Makebuko.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kirundo rural. He was caught trying to steal courgettes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: 2 Imbonerakure beat a supporter of UPRONA. They accused him of hoarding weapons.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: At a public meeting in Mpanda, a girl complained that the Imbonerakure threaten and intimidate the population, with the support of the local MPs. After the meeting the Imbonerakure surrounded her and beat her up.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure moved around the market place in Kayogoro with sticks and batons, beating people to force them to close their stalls and participate in a party meeting.
Unidentified armed men attacked and killed a man and his wife using machetes and clubbed their baby to death. It is believed that the attack was because of accusations of witchcraft.

When police came to arrest people from Kizina village, in Gihanga, the villagers surrounded the area and refused to allow the police in. Once the police had left, they attacked the people who they believed had informed the police, damaging their houses and beating them. The village is part of a land dispute.
Unidentified attackers set off 2 grenades in Munyika, near Rugombo. A 5 year old child was killed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: 2 young students were beaten by imbonerakure in their school.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man to death. This man had been caught trying to steal from an FNL Rwasa supporter's house. The police arrested the FNL Rwasa supporter and are accusing him of murder.
A man who had participated in the protests against Nkurunziza's third term was killed by unidentified attackers, who clubbed him to death.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man in Bukemba murdered his wife and then fled his house. The local imbonerakure chased him down and beat him to death.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure raped a 16 year old girl in Bubanza.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: On 20 January, an FNL member was assaulted in a bar by Imbonerakure.
2 policemen in Mungwa tied up and beat a man who they accused of theft. Local peace officials intervened.
A policeman was killed by unidentified attackers on Kiyazi hill. This policeman had fled Makamba town because he had been threatened by Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: In January 2018, the zone chief and local Imbonerakure pulled a man out of his car at a roadblock in Karusi province and beat him with sticks and clubs after he did not have his receipt for registering to vote.
A group of unidentified armed men attacked a military patrol in Gihanga. The gunfire lasted more than twenty minutes, before the attackers retreated into the Rukoko Nature Reserve.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Nyanza-Lac beat and raped a woman.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 Imbonerakure beat and raped a woman in Bogogwa.

A woman and her 3 year old were killed by unidentified attackers in Gikuyo. The head of the family was also seriously injured in the attack. The police claim it was land conflicts, but the neighbours believe it was a political attack.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 imbonerakure tried to block the governor of Nyabitsinda commune. The governor had his police guard beat the imbonerakure, and accused them of threatening his authority.

A family living on Rambo hill, in Gikuyo town, were victims of a grenade attack. The wife and her 3 year old died on the spot, the husband died in hospital shortly afterwards. The attackers are unknown, but it is speculated that the attack was either revenge against the husband for his role in the 1993 massacres, or to do with suspicions of witchcraft.
Staff at the Kinyinya Hospital organised a protest against the contributions paid to the ruling party. The following day, 12 nurses were arrested for participating.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teacher at Gasenyi School in Musonge was beaten by several young Imbonerakure. They accused him of punishing the students unfairly, but apparently he was targeted because they suspect he is a rebel.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: The head of the SNR in Muyinga arrested 12 youths in downtown Muyinga. 8 were released a few hours later, the other 4 were driven out of Muyinga in an SNR vehicle. They were beaten by SNR officers in the vehicle. On the same day, SNR in Muyinga arrested and severely beat a man. They accused him of being involved in a murder.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: An imbonerakure demanded a beer from an MSD supporter and then beat her and dragged her onto the street when she refused.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: Astere Tumukunde, an FNL Rwasa supporter and a teacher at a school in Busoni, was arrested by Imbonerakure in front of his students. He was held in Busoni prison, where he was beaten. He is accused of telling people to vote against the constitutional referendum. Tumukende is one of many FNL Rwasa supporters targeted for voter education in recent weeks.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Bucana hill was beaten by Imbonerakure, using clubs and wires. The imbonerakure accused the man of bewitching the local head of the imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: A group of 4 students were beaten by 5 Imbonerakure on Burenge hill because they had been overheard saying that they would vote no in the constitutional referendum.

A man from Ruhinga was found hanged. Although the authorities claim it is a suicide, his relatives insist that it was a political death, because the family was active in the protests against Nkrunziza's 3rd term.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure wielding machetes attacked a man in Kinindo.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure wielding machetes attacked a man as he returned to his home in Kinindo. He was hospitalised for 2 days.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure youth and police officers clashed when the Imbonerakure taunted the police. The police fired on the youths, injuring one of them.
The residents of Karambo beat a man to death. They accused him of stealing. The police have taken no action against the vigilantes.

assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: Arrests: Between 12 December and 18 January, 42 members of the Amizero y'Abarundi ("Burundian Hope") political coalition have been arbitrarily arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Ntunda attacked and beat a bartender.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man in Kinindo who broke curfew, and then beat a man who tried to intervene.
A family in Murwi was attacked by unidentified men wielding machetes. The reasons for the attack are unclear.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure attacked and beat the guests attending the new year's eve party of a local FNL Rwasa supporter in Ntega. They accused the party guests of holding a clandestine meeting.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was severely injured in a fight between 2 factions of Imbonerakure in Gifurwe. He was left to die on the banks of the river.

actor1: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: FNL Rwasa supporters beat an Imbonerakure in Musenyi.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: A pastor in Nyabibuye was stabbed by 2 Imbonerakure because he belongs to the MSD party. He was seriously injured.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 5 FNL Rwasa supporters were arrested on 28/12 in Gihanga. They were detained for 2 days and beaten in the police cells. They are accused of instructing people to vote against Nkurunziza's constitutional reform referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teenager from Jimbi hill was beaten by Imbonerakure because he has not joined the Imbonerakure.
A security guard in Gihofi was killed by unidentified attackers.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure manning a checkpoint in Butarugera stopped a group of men. The men had kalashnikov rifles, with which they attacked the Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A 20 year old was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure in Rutegama.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A trader from Bugenyuzi was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused her of robbery, although there was no evidence that she had stolen anything, causing observers to think that she was targeted for political reasons. She was held for 9 days.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The youth leader of the MSD was kidnapped by the SNR in Muzinda. He had recently returned from Kenya, where he had been exiled.

actor1: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
notes: FNL Nzabampema militants attempted to ambush the Route 5 near Gihanga, but were repulsed by soldiers.

A man from Murengezi was killed by unidentified attackers and his body was dumped in the Mpanda river. He is believed to have been targeted because he refused to sell his land to the president's wife.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An influential Imbonerakure in Mubuga, working with the police, arrested and beat an FNL Rwasa supporter. He was accused of sending information to radio stations based in Rwanda.

The head of the police in Nyabiraba beat a local shopkeeper. When the administrator of the commune intervened, the police blamed the shopkeeper, saying he should be punished for refusing to pay contributions to the police.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure beat a teacher in Bumba because she did not have her identity card. When the teacher complained to the headmaster, he instructed her to obey the Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa activist living in Kabizi was attacked and seriously injured by an Imbonerakure patrol, for breaking the curfew.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: The SNR in Rutegama had 2 prisoners beaten. The prisoners were arrested the previous day.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: The head of the Rutegama police station and the local SNR had 3 people publicly beaten. They accused them of stealing a radio from a bar, although there was no evidence for the crime. 2 of the victims were then incarcerated in the jail.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa activist was arrested on Nyarurambi hill by the Kayanza SNR. He was beaten and held in custody for several hours. He was accused of holding meetings to plot to vote against Nkurunziza in the referendum.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 2 young men in Mutobo were arrested by a police officer, who accused them of attempting to steal his rifle. The police beat them and then the military transported them to Bujumbura in a military vehicle, beating them while the vehicle was travelling. Aother youth from Mutobo disappeared on the same day. He is believed to have been abducted by the same security forces. The police commander is trying to force the youths to admit that they are stealing weapons to join a rebellion against Nkurunziza.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A young man in Nyabigina was beaten by Imbonerakure on patrol.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A young FNL Rwasa supporter in Rutambiro was abducted by SNR officials. His family has not seen him since the abduction.

actor1: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 18 December. Police arrested five members of the FNL-R in the Ruyigi province for holding an unauthorized meeting
A family in Nyarutovu, near Gitaramuka was attacked by an unidentified armed group wielding machetes. The wife was killed and the husband badly injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: The Imbonerakure beat the chief of Kamaramagambo hill during the nightly curfew patrol.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An elderly man was detained for 3 days and severely beaten by Imbonerakure because he refused to put up a poster supporting the president.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: An UPRONA supporter was killed by 2 Imbonerakure in his home in Musema.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: In December 2017, a resident of Rumonge province was beaten by Imbonerakure for refusing to pay money for the May 2018 referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A businessman in Makamba was severely beaten by Imbonerakure and local officials. They accused him of stealing a phone battery, however, he believes that he was beaten because he was overheard saying that he would not vote in support of Nkurunziza's constitutional referendum.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 Imbonerakure beat a man in Mugozi. They accused him of disrupting security by arguing with his wife, but he is believed to have been targeted for political reasons.
2 people died and 3 people were captured in an exchange of fire between police and an armed group in Mpishi. The police also captured weapons which had been stolen from police earlier in the year.

actor2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Bike taxi drivers protested at the Cotebu market in Ngagara after an Imbonerakure had confiscated a bike. The SNR tried to suppress the protest and clashed with the protesters.

actor2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: Bike taxi drivers protested in Nyakabiga, they clashed with the SNR.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure tied up a man from Gasave and beat him. He was accused of stealing.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teacher was arrested, publicly humiliated, and then taken to the Muyinga jail and beaten by a group of Imbonerakure. They accused him of sexually abusing his servant, but it is believed that he was targeted for having criticised the ruling party.
A grenade was thrown at the Hotel Passos in Kayanza. There were no injuries.
A group of people in Muyinya, Kabuye, beat a man to death when they found him stealing from a shop.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: The Imbonerakure chief in Minago beat youth who attended the screening of a football match. He accused them of breaking the curfew, although the youth claim that there is no official curfew in Minago.
A grenade was thrown into a bar in Bwiza at around 8pm by unidentified attackers. 3 people were seriously injured.

Arrests: 30 people were arrested in relation to a grenade thrown in the Hotel Passos. The people were passers-by who had run when they heard the explosion. They were detained for 15 days with no charges.

20 November- 20 December. Three additional grenade attacks reported in the Bujumbura Marie and Muramvya provinces between these dates. Coded as 2 grenade attacks in Bujumbura Mairie and 1 in Muramvya at various points during the period.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A Frodebu supporter was beaten by 4 Imbonerakure in Rango. He was accused of failing to pay a contribution to the CNDD-FDD.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: Police officers raided a church in Rutegama. They accused the churchgoers, who were conducting an all-night prayer service, of meeting to plan to destabilise the government. They beat all the attendants, including the women and children.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The school secretary in Buganda was abducted by the head of the National Intelligence Services.
Police officers rounded up bicycle taxi drivers in Cibitoke. They were forced to pay a tax 2000-5000BIF. If they could not pay, they were beaten and their bicycles were confiscated.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter from Cewe was attacked and beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused him of fishing in the lake.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Unidentified attackers threw a grenade into a house in Buyenzi. One person was injured. The neighbours believe that a policeman's family was being targeted.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade at people waiting in a bus station in Musaga. 3 people were injured.
An elderly man from Buyaga, Muzye, was killed by unidentified attackers.
A Burundian deputy in the East African Legislative Assemby was injured when gunmen fired at him in Kigobe.
A man was caught stealing sweet potatoes in Mishiha, the community attacked him with machetes and hacked him to death.
A grenade was thrown in a bus parking lot in Bwiza. A number of people were seriously injured.
The chief of the Mpishi hill was attacked in his home by unidentified attackers. One of his visitors was hit by a bullet.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: A youth from Bwiza was arrested by the SNR and detained for 10 days. He was tortured by the SNR. He was arrested because he took a photograph of a person wounded in the attack.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: CNDD-FDD supporters in a neighbourhood in Buhayira attacked and nearly killed one of their neighbours, who they accused of bewitching a CNDD-FDD supporter.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure tied up and beat a 60 year old FNL Rwasa supporter. When he tried to complain to the police, the police accused him of having demolished a bridge, and arrested him. He was released soon after due to his health condition after the beating.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: The police in Muramvya arrested and beat the headmaster of a local school and a member of the FNL Rwasa. The police accused the men of instigating the attack on civilians by a machete-wielding assailant a few weeks previously.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: A member of the MSD Butaganzwa committee was killed by Imbonerakure in his home in Busokoza because he continues to hold MSD meetings in his neighbourhood.

20 November- 20 December. Three additional grenade attacks reported in the Bujumbura Marie and Muramvya provinces between these dates. Coded as 2 grenade attacks in Bujumbura Mairie and 1 in Muramvya at various points during the period.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: A gas station attendant was beaten by SNR agents, who discovered that Imbonerakure had been extorting fuel at that gas station. She was critically injured.
Unidentified attackers beheaded a man and left his body on a hill in Kayanza. His body was found on 30 November - precise date of death unclear.
Unidentified attackers tied up and killed a civilian and then left his body in the Kibira forest. His decomposing body was found on 29 November - precise date of death unclear.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: The former administrator of Kirundo, an UPRONA supporter, was killed by unidentified attackers at his home in Nyange.

assoc_actor_2: UPRONA: Union for National Progress
notes: An UPRONA Nditjie member was assassinated by unidentified attackers in Kirundo.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: The head of the SNR in Muyinga beat a youth for having looked at him in the face.
On 28 November, a BUCECO employee was kidnapped in Bujumbura.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: SNR agents in Muyinga beat a youth, whom they accused of walking too close to their post. He was saved by people near the scene who called for injustice.
A policeman guarding a gas station in Karonda beat a civilian who resisted paying a bribe with a stick, leaving him severely injured.

A young man in Rushubi was beaten by residents, who accused him of stealing. He died of his injuries the following week.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 youths were beaten by Imbonerakure in Kibago. They had failed to contribute to the building of the CNDD-FDD office in Kibago.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The local MSD leader in Kibaya was arrested and beaten by the police. He was accused of rebellion because he has not been encouraging his members to attend CNDD-FDD meetings.

assoc_actor_2: Fishermen (Burundi)
notes: 24 November. Burundian police reported that military forces of Rwanda kidnapped fishermen on Lake Rweru in Muyinga province. They were later released. The reason for the abduction is not known.

A mob of people in Gahwazi rioted and chased a man down the street until the chief of the hill intervened and stopped them. The man was accused of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

A man was clubbed to death in Mikoni, Gahombo.

When Cankuzo police tried to clear a group of soldiers from Mutukura Camp out of a Cankuzo bar, the soldiers retaliated, resulting in violent clashes. The police chief dispersed the crowd by firing into the air, and then the police pursued the soldiers back to the camp.

The head of the Port and Rail Maritime Authority in Rumonge was beaten by police officers when they realised that he was filming them taking bribes from merchants in the port.

A man in Gitongo was hacked to death using a machete by unidentified assailants.
A woman was beaten and killed and then dumped in the Ruvyironza River in Makebuko.
A person was killed and dumped in the Ruhwa River.
A woman was tied up and killed. Her body was dumped in the Jiji River.
A man was strangled in Gahoma.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A grenade was thrown into the house of a CNDD-FDD leader in Ruramba. There was some property damage.
A woman was beaten and strangled in Nyavyamo. It is believed that she was killed by the police.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: A Tutsi student at the Mutanga campus of the university was beaten up by Imbonerakure with clubs and forced to walk across campus on his knees. This is part of ongoing harassment of students at the Mutanga campus by groups of club-wielding Imbonerakure. Date unclear - report dated 18 August.

Arrests: 36 young people, including 24 from the Ruhoro displacement site, were arrested by police as they were traveling to Tanzania from Ruhororo. Two days before, on 14 August, 21 young people were also arrested at Kinyinya commune in Ryigi province for seeeking to make their way to Tanzania for work.
A total of 12 bodies were found in the Ruhwa River between June and September 2017.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man in Gahago, in Vugizo, was beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused him of stealing apples.

notes: A year 7 pupil was beaten by Imbonerakure.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the convoy of the governor of Bubanza, leading to clashes with his bodyguards. No injuries were reported.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A youth from Mabanda was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure.

2 civilians were killed and 5 civilians were injured in a grenade attack on a bar in Buyenzi, Bujumbura. It is believed that the attackers were targeting police officers.

A grenade was thrown into a home in Kibonde. 1 person was seriously injured and was taken to hospital.
Police in the Musenyi market accused a man of insolence and beat him with batons and then held him for 4 hours.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: 2 men were beaten and arrested by the National Intelligence Service. They are being held under suspicion over the grenade attacks in Bwiza.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a mill owner in Rugeyo.

notes: Imbonerakure beat a trader with clubs at the Kirambi market.

Gunmen ambush a civilian minibus and execute the driver.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The CNDD-FDD organised a march to demonstrate their support for Nkurunziza in Gitobe.
Unidentified gunmen ambushed a minibus at Kagunuzi. Security forces intervened and shots were exchanged. It is believed that the gunmen then escaped to the DRC.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Up to 10,000 Imbonerakure demonstrated in Bujumbura to deounce the opposition.

notes: A member of the CNDD-FDD was kidnapped by unidentified attackers in Maramvya.

notes: An imbonerakure raped a 13 year old.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A former FAB soldier was kidnapped by the military and taken to the marshes north of Bujumbura, where he was tortured and shot dead.
Unidentified armed men attempted an ambush in Gihanga, but were prevented by the police.
A man from Muriza was killed for witchcraft.
A young man in Nyabibuye was stabbed to death with a bayonet.
A man in Nyakibanda was strangled.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: The head of the Ruzingati sub-hill tried to extort money from a student. When the student refused he got the Imbonerakure to beat the student.

assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: Prisoners in Rutana Prison rioted, drumming, banging pans, ripping down doors, and throwing stones at the police. The police fired gunshots to suppress the prisoners. No injuries have been reported.

notes: A CNDD-FDD supporter was beaten up by FNL Agathon Rwasa supporters in Mubanda, Mpanda.

Burundian soldiers in the Rukoko Nature Reserve shot and killed a soldier. According to some sources, one of the soldiers had embezzled a weapon. According to other sources, a soldier was killed as he was fleeing.
Scuffles broke out at the Musenyi market, when the police tried to shut down the stalls. A mob of traders tore the uniform of the police chief.
An unidentified group threw a grenade out of a car at the patrons of the Kubajandarume bar, in Bwiza, Bujumbura. 7 people were killed and at least 30 people were injured.
A man who went to water his field was attacked by unidentified men wielding machetes and sticks in a village of Gihanga, leaving him severely injured.
A widow and her son were seriously injured by unidentified assailants, who stabbed them in their house over a land dispute.
A woman and her son were attacked in their home by unidentified assailants in relation to a land dispute.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man in Gihehe was not carrying his identity card, so Imbonerakure arrested and beat him.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Kirundo held a demonstration where they wielded sticks and sang songs in support of Nkurunziza.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man and a girl who had missed the curfew in Ngugo. The girl has been hospitalised.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A soldier was stopped and beaten by a group of 12 Imbonerakure, who accused him of collaborating with thieves.
7 people were injured in a grenade attack in Mukaza.
A total of 12 bodies were found in the Ruhwa River between June and September 2017.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Kirundo held a demonstration where they wielded sticks and sang songs in support of Nkurunziza.
Non-violent activity: A mass grave containing more than 100 bodies was discovered near Mabanda town. Witnesses believe that the mass grave dates back to the 1972 pogrom.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Kirambi held a demonstration to protest the EU and to demonstrate their support for Nkurunziza.
2 suspected thieves were hacked to death with machetes by a crowd in Ndava.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade in Ruhehe. A woman and her 3 children were injured in the attack. 12 people were arrested by the SNR following the attack.
A man was decapitated and dismembered by unidentified attackers.
A man was beheaded and maimed by unidentified perpetrators.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 Imbonerakure beat up and intimidated 3 teenagers in the Jene market.
A man was killed near Rumonge. Police claim that it was a suicide, but human rights organisations have expressed their concern about the death.
Four policemen were injured as a result of a grenade attack that occurred at 9pm in central Bujumbura. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A 16 year old in Kayogoro was beaten by Imbonerakure until he lost consciousness and then abducted. His family has not been able to locate him.
Residents of Kiderege gathered with machetes to protest the land distribution between residents and returnees. The crowd clashed with returnees, and had to be broken up by the police.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Nyagitika was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of spreading rumours about an attack on Burundi on whatsapp.

Eight killed and 40 wounded in a grenade attack at Shinya, Gatara restaurant. No one has so far claimed responsibility for the attack but authorities have "categorically rejected a political motive" and "prefer to link this to an act of terrorism."
A man was stabbed to death in Rweza. His body was dumped in the river.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure conducted a round-up of women in the streets of Makamba. The women were accuseed of being prostitutes and jailed, where they were beaten and sexually assaulted by the Imbonerakure.
A woman in Gihanga was stabbed and beheaded over a land conflict.

notes: Imbonerakure beat 2 FNL-Rwasa activists. The police then arrested the 2 activists and accused them of treason. The Imbonerakure also beat the wife of one of the Rwasa activists.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure tied up and beat a person in Mutwazi who had not paid a party member.

notes: A man from Ngoma was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of failing to pay the animal tax.
A man was beaten to death by an unidentified group in a land dispute.

notes: 400 Imbonerakure held a march in Mwakiro. They waved branches and sang that the ruling party would never leave power.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A soldier on leave was arrested and beaten. It is believed that he was arrested over land conflicts.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 men from Mutobo were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused them of stealing.

A policeman was beheaded by unidentified assailants while he was guarding the post office.
A policeman on patrol was attacked and killed by an unidentified armed group near the Musigati Post Office.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure held a demonstration, where they sang songs threatening to kill Rwandans and people who had fled to Rwanda.
A girl was kidnapped by an unidentified group in Mungwa, Gitega.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The deputy head of the CNDD-FDD was abducted by unidentified agents from Butavuka in Muzinda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat and drowned a man in Rukere because he sold coffee to a man from a neighbouring region.
A man from Bugwana in Gitobe was believed to be a wizard. He was killed with knives and machetes.
Rwandan soldiers fired shots at 2 fishermen on the Ruhwa River. One of the fishermen fled, the other one was kidnapped by the soldiers.
A girl in Kivoga was raped and murdered by unidentified assailants.
A man was killed by unidentifed assailants and dumped between Mishiha and Gisagara.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: A man from Rurira was killed in Ruhororo colline by 3 Imbonerakure because they believed he was a Tutsi. He was in fact a Hutu.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure were trying to force people to 'donate' their harvest to the ruling party. The people in Yaranda rioted against the Imbonerakure's imposition, injuring 3 of the Imbonerakure.
Arrests: 30 Pentecostal worshippers in Jimbi were accused of insurrection and arrested.
An elderly man in Nyempundu was accused of witchcraft and assassinated with a machete at 7pm.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter who had just returned from exile in Rwanda was attacked and choked in a bar in Gitongo. He survived the attack.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: More than 20 Imbonerakure beat up a group of 7 people who had gathered near a bar in Bucana. The Imbonerakure accused them of holding an FNL Rwasa meeting. The victims were forced to pay fines to the police.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A grenade was thrown in a bar in Rwiri, Murwi. No one was injured. Imbonerakure beat and arrested 2 people who fled from the bar in fear when the grenade was thrown, as they suspected them of being the assaillants. They released them a few days later.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Tutsi Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: 2 men were beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused them of being enemies of the nation because they are Tutsi.

Scuffles broke out between Musaga bus drivers, who wanted to attend the funeral of a fellow bus driver killed in a grenade attack on 14/6, and police and council authorities, who tried to force the drivers to attend community work instead. 4 bus drivers were arrested during the scuffles.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire in a bar in Kiganza, killing 1 person.
The deputy chief of police beat a member of the youth orchestra with his rifle butt.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was beaten and trampled by Imbonerakure.
A man was shot dead at his door by unidentified armed men, who followed him home.
A total of 12 bodies were found in the Ruhwa River between June and September 2017.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A veteran of the CNDD-FDD was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused him of being an opposition member. He has since fled Gatagura hill.
A man was shot dead by police officers in Kamenge.
A grenade was thrown into a crowd of people near a bus station in the opposition stronghold of Musaga. 2 people were killed and 9 people were injured.
3 people accused of witchcraft were killed by vigilante militias in Mugina.
Grenade attack in Musaga left at least one bus driver killed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a Rugabano resident with clubs. They were suspicious of his political allegiance because he has not participated in CNDD-FDD activities. The man is currently recovering in hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 groups of Imbonerakure clashed in Ntunda. There had been an argument about which group had the rights to 'tax' civilians in the neighbourhood.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter and his servant were attacked by people wielding machetes. The neighbours believe that the attack was carried out by Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Rugwiza was beaten by Imbonerakure.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure. His spine was damaged.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure leader beat a young mandazi seller on Bigwa hill in Ruyaga. He accused the youth of spying for the Imbonerakure's enemies. He was left injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Kirambi was murdered. The neighbours believe that he was killed by Imbonerakure.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3,500 couples attended a mass event to formalise their marriages, according to the new law. When they realised that the Imbonerakure had turned the ceremony into a party event and that there was no food, the participants rioted. 3 people were killed in the scuffles between Imbonerakure and rioting newlyweds.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was abducted by the head of the Imbonerakure in Rugombo. He was strangled and his body was thrown in the river.
A police officer was killed in a gunfight between police officers in Bujumbura.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure assaulted and tried to drown a man from Mbuye. They accused him of being a rebel.
2 streetchildren were arrested and beaten by police officers, who accused them of destabilising Bujumbura. No one knows where the streetchildren are being held.
A man was killed by an unidentified group in Gihosha.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: 2 young MSD supporters were beaten and arrested by Imbonerakure and police. They were accused of insulting elected officials.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 Imbonerakure in Gihanga beat a man and charged him BIF20,000 for disturbing the peace. He was left injured.
A woman was killed in an attack on her home in Gishunzi. Her neighbours believe that she was attacked because she has refused to join the CNDD-FDD.
A woman from Kirambi was murdered. Her neighbours believe that Imbonerakure murdered her.
A man suspected of witchcraft was beaten to death by people in his village, Karagara. His house was also burned down.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: The SNR beat a chief and held him in custody. He does not know why he was targeted.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A teacher was held up by a group of Imbonerakure. They demanded to see his identity card. When he did not have it, they beat him severely.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march to protest against the EU, Human Rights Watch, and Iteka, who have criticised the Burundian government.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Major Dieudonne Karashira was killed at Cankuzo Military camp. A man has been arrested in response.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: The CNDD-FDD leader of the Baziro area beat an FNL Rwasa supporter at around 7pm for opposing the payment of contributions to the party building project.
Between 7pm and 8pm police overturned stalls and forced traders to close their shops. The traders grew angry and threw stones at the police. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: Agreement: The government of Burundi released 2,500 prisoners (nearly a quarter of the prison population)
A body was found on 28/1. The victim was wearing handcuffs and had been shot in the head.
A woman's body was found in her home, hacked by machetes.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Following the an attack on the Mukoni camp, Warrant Officer Francis Nkunzimana and around 30 other soldiers were arrested and handed over to the police. The next day Nkunzimana's body was found on the savannah, riddled with bullets, along with two other bodies. One of the other soldiers arrested was beheaded. The other soldiers complained of severe torture.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An imbonerakure raped a 14 year old school girl as she returned home.

Unidentified gunmen attacked Mukoni Military camp in the early hours of Tuesday morning. Following this incident a patrol went out and burned the savannah where the gunmen were reportedly hiding to flush them out.

assoc_actor_2: Herders (Burundi)
notes: A shepherd was killed.
A man and his sister were talking outside her home, when they were apprehended by police and beaten. The man lost consciousness.
Police assaulted a young man near the Musaga market. When onlookers attempted to help him, they chased them away.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 9 youth who did not have identity documents were assaulted by Imbonerakure and then taken to the communal police station.

When soldiers discovered a grenade on a plot, they beat the girl who lived there with their rifle butts until the Deputy Head of the hill intervened.
A man was attacked by unidentified men armed with guns and machetes.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)

A man accused of witchcraft was killed. 10 people have been arrested.
2 brothers were attacked by people throwing grenades at around 11pm. 1 died on the spot and the other was wounded.

The police carried out a household search. They assaulted a man who resisted them when they attempted to enter his house.
A man was arrested by the police. His body was discovered the next day by the cowherds. The local authorities issued an urgent order to bury the boy without an investigation.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: In January 2017, Imbonerakure members abducted a man in Rumonge province. He has not been seen since and is assumed dead but not confirmed.
A man was arrested and beaten by order of the head of the police post, who heard him insulting the police while drunk.
Unidentified armed men killed 2 men and a child in a shooting in Muyira. 6 people have been arrested.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A CNDD-FDD militant was killed by unidentified assailants. His body was found on 14 January

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure assaulted a man and a woman and locked them up. The imbonerakure accused them of adultery, but it is believed that they were targeted because the woman is from Musaga, a hot spot during the anti-Nkurunziza protests.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure accused a man of stealing a goat and beat him to death. They were arrested but released soon after.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 men were decapitated and dismembered by Imbonerakure.
A woman was killed by villagers, who believed that she was a witch.
2 people suspected of witchcraft were killed by their neighbours, who wielded clubs and machetes.
3 families were attacked by unkown assailants wielding cudgels. The families were told that they were attacked because they were known to support General Niyombare.
Construction workers discovered a mass grave in Rusaka. 6 skulls have been found.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: A CNDD-FDD party activist was attacked by unknown assailants.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

A staff member of the NGO CARE was abducted by policemen and driven to Bugarama in a civilian car.

assoc_actor_2: Herders (Burundi)

notes: Imbonerakure staged a march to protest against Rwanda.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Burundi (2005-)
notes: The Burundi Minister of the Environment, Emmanuel Niyokuru, was killed by gunmen on his way home.

A transmission agent for the local police commissioner assaulted 2 men with his belt and fined them BIF100,000. He accused them of having been at a clandestine meeting because they were returning from a bar. The next day the police returned the money to the men so that would not file a case.
A woman disappeared from a Gikungu bar. 4 days later her body was found on the shores of Lake Tanganyika.
Boy wounded by bullet in Buterere.
One man killed by unknown gunmen in a car driving through Nyakabiga.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: 8 people were injured when a grenade exploded in the Church of Heaven. The pastor has been arrested.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Burundi)
notes: A man climbed onto a church and threw a grenade through the roof during New Year's Eve celebrations. 8 people were injured.
A shopkeeper was abducted.
A young girl was attacked by unidentified assailants and seriously wounded.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was arrested and beaten up because the police accused him of stealing the deputy head of the commune's kepi. The police and imbonerakure threatened to shoot him in the head and made him pay BIF300,000 to avoid going to prison.
A man who had been accused of being a rainmaker was killed because of the lack of rains.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A restaurant waiter was beaten by Imbonerakure until he lost consciousness

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure assaulted a man who had argued with his wife. She pleaded that they not arrest him because their quarrel was domestic.

assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: A Batwa man was beaten to death.
3 youths were arrested and put in a common cell. One was tortured with sticks.

A man who had fought a policeman in a bar was arrested and detained. In the police cells he was assaulted by 2 policemen

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: A woman was assaulted by Imbonerakure at around 7pm.

A man, his wife, and their child were attacked and killed by an unidentified group armed with machetes as they returned home at 20.00
A woman was abducted and tortured. Her arm was cut off and she was killed. Her body was found two days later near her home.
The governor of Makamba discovered 11 people watching a video together during a curfew patrol. He had them severely beaten.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was tortured and imprisoned by Imbonerakure. He was accused of criticising the administration.
Unidentified people set off grenade at 10pm in Rureng. A man and a woman riding a motorcycle were caught in the blast. The woman was killed and the man seriously injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A small-trader who was collecting a debt from another person was delivered to the Imbonerakure, who beat him. He was then imprisoned for 2 days.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

A woman was killed when a grenade was thrown at her family while they were resting.
Unidentified men armed with pistols abducted an unidentified boy outside the US Embassy.
A group of unidentified armed men attacked the Musha Hill Market on the night of 17/12. They went into the market and started shooting, seriously wounding 2 people.

2 armed men broke into the Phoenicia Hotel in Bururi, where they threw grenades and fired at people. The attack left 7 injured, including 3 policemen. 20 people have been arrested following the attack.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure assaulted a man in the street, who they accused of stealing.
