actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure entered a household at 7.30pm, saying they were searching for weapons. They assaulted the inhabitants, so severely that one has lost a finger.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Security measures: The governor of Makamba stopped a car and intimidated and threatened the passengers for an hour.
Security measures: The governor of Makamba shut the bar run by a military official on the grounds that it is used to hold clandestine meetings. The governor is cracking down on bars in Makamba.
The warden of Ngagara was abducted and detained by 2 men driving a landcruiser vehicle. It is believed that he is considered to be disrespectful of the authorities.
The body of Nimbona, a man imprisoned because he is believed to have killed General Nshirimana, was discovered. He had been tied up and hit on the head.
Security measures: Police and Imbonerakure cordoned off a school and conducted a search of all the students.
Unidentified men assaulted a man. Police say they are investigating the incident.
A man called Nyandwi was found decapitated in the bush. He had disappeared 2 days previously.
Security measures: Police conducted an early-morning search on the house of a man who is currently in prison for presumed collaboration with the rebels.
A young woman was assaulted by police officers who were attempting to arrest her over a payment dispute. A journalist who witnessed the scene was threatened with violence if he reported the incident.
A policeman fired shots to stop speeding motorcyclists. They then attacked him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: Imbonerakure disrupted a group of Rwasa supporters in a house. They tied them up and asssaulted them with clubs and machetes. The Rwasa supporters were held in custody for 2 days and then released.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa activist was assaulted by the head of the communal police in a bar. The policeman demanded to know whether the activist supported Nkurunzizas 3rd term. When the activist was silent, the policeman began to beat him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

Arrests: Fifty-four people were arrested by police in a bar calls "Kukaguru". Local sources said those arrested are all members of a group named Whatsapp RPA in reference to African Public Radio. Police accused them of disseminating rumors and insults against the institutions on social networks. 46 people were released on August 21.

Six people were injured, 3 seriously, in a grenade attack that occurred near a bar. Local sources said the perpetrators and the reasons for this attack are still unknown at this time. Furthermore, they pointed that this same bar, mostly frequented by opposition activists, was the target of a similar attack in February, leaving two dead and three seriously injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

Property destruction: A house was set on fire by unknown people at 3am. The family was able to escape, but their belongings that were in the house went up in smoke. The reasons and the perpetrators of this incident remain unknown.

Arrests: Sixty young men were arrested by Imbonerakure between August 18 and 19 in Kayogoro capital, and taken to the municipal police station. Local sources said the group was sent down from the buses leaving for Tanzania where they claim to work in tobacco plantations.

Six people were beaten up and injured by a group armed with rifles and machetes. Local sources said the victims could recognise three of their attackers: protesters against the third term which had been delivered to the police.

Arrests: Sixty young men were arrested by Imbonerakure between August 18 and 19 in Kayogoro capital, and taken to the municipal police station. Local sources said the group was sent down from the buses leaving for Tanzania where they claim to work in tobacco plantations.

The 5 neighbours were accused of covering him up. He was released on August 20 after a payment of 300.000BIF for the alleged owner of these weapons and 30.000, 50.000, 130.000BIF for three of the alleged accomplices. Local sources said reportedly the man who is expected to pay 300.000BIF left on August 21 to an unknown destination.

A young man was arrested by the police and taken to the prison of the town where he was reportedly beaten up. He has been a protester against the third term of Nkurunziza and he was beaten up for alleged involvement in an armed group. Local sources stated that this man was mistreated because of his position against the third term. People living near the prison where he was held said they heard his screams overnight when he was beaten by the head of the police station.

This man was tortured on August 17 by the police in order for him to show them where a rebel group was positioned (which he should have shown to Imbonerakure, members of the CNDD-FDD, and police). According to his lawyers, 11 armed people including 4 women dressed in military uniforms, have forced him to give them information they wanted, but this man says they have been evasive.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A youth was arrested, beaten up, and taken to prison by police officers. The man (who returned from exile) was accused of killing people. A local source said his family asked for his release, but he was taken away in the evening at the National Intelligence Service office. One of the family members of the arrested man asserts that they are regularly intimidated by the authorities and Imbonerakure accusing them of belonging to rebel movements.

A man was arrested on his return from exile. He was tortured and then held in the offices of the Regina Mundi Cathedral. On 23 August he was sentenced to 1 year in prison for participating in an insurrection movement and in armed gangs. He has no attorney and pleads innocence.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-); Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: The head of the police station of Gihanga was ambushed by gunmen on the National Highway No. 5 (RN5). He was able to escape unharmed after the rapid intervention of military and police. The attackers retreated to the forest Rukoko. A local source says that nothing suggests we was ambushed for being the police chief as there were other vehicles on the road. No damage reported.
Chief of Gatete hill, Evrard Rwamigabo, was seriously injured by palm plantation guards.
A lifeless body was found in Ruvyironza river. It is not possible to identify him because of the advanced state of decomposition.
Defusal: A grenade was found by some traders who immediately alerted the authorities. The police and Imbonerakure confiscated the device.

A man (a taxi driver) visiting his wife who had just given birth at the Ruyaga Health Centre was beaten with belts and fists and feet by the head of the police station; he was kept in custody until the morning of Tuesday, August 9. The station chief and his guard first searched the taxi drivers car before hitting him with an object; nothing compromising was found in his car. The police asked the driver to bring his vehicle to the police station; the driver objected, saying he saw no reason. As a result, the man was beaten in front of his two children; he was taken to jail at the police station despite his poor health. He was released on Wednesday, August 10.
Three killed, including young children, by a grenade attack.
Non-violent activity: Explosions and gunshots heard in Gitwa quarter. The perpetrators and motive remain unknown.
A family in Rugunga witnessed a grenade attack. No damage to people or property has been reported.
Two bodies found in Mubarazi river. They were bound and naked, showed signs of torture, and one was decapitated.

assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: Property destruction: A group of armed men attacked a FRODEBU members house. The perpetrators escaped after the man alerted his neighbors, though not before leaving an unexploded grenade at the scene. The motive for this incident is unknown.
Teacher killed, body found on the side of the road.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Annual communal festivities turned into a political protest by supporters of the ruling party against perceived interference by the UN, Rwanda, France, and Belgium.
A woman was raped on August 7 in a locality where a number of other rapes have occurred at the hands of a group of 5 unknown men.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A lifeless body has been found in Mugara. He was a High School teacher and CNDD activist and a lover of political debates in bars. He has apparently been strangled by his aggressors . According to a local source, the perpetrators took everything he had on him and for the moment it is unknown if the incident occurred as a result of his political affiliation.
During the celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities, demonstrations against the deployment of foreign troops in Burundi took place.

During the celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities in Gitega, residents marched in protest of the deployment of UN police asked by France, and against Rwanda who welcomed the Burundian rebels remembering that Burundi is independent.

During the celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities in Gitega, the residents marched in protest of the deployment of UN police and the statement from the presidency to the municipalities that recalls that Burundi is sovereign and stable, stating that it does not need foreign troops on its soil.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On the day dedicated to municipalities, Imbonerakure protested, running through the streets with placards saying "We are against Kagame and France".
A man was murdered over the night on August 6. Reportedly, he was part of a group of bandits and was pulled out of his house by his aggressors who tortured him before killing him on Karugunda hill.
During the celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities in Mutaho, the residents marched in protest of the deployment of UN police and against Rwanda.
3 men were beaten up by the head of the police station in Ntega, who called them "ibipinga" for being absent from the demonstrations against the deployment of UN police on Burundian soil.

During the celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities in Gitega, the residents marched in protest of the deployment of UN police asked by France, and against Rwanda who welcomed the Burundian rebels remembering that Burundi is independent, as well as against some human rights organizations such as Human Rights Watch.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The ruling party has marched in protest against the deployment of UN police officers in Burundi, the actions against President Kagame, against France, Belgium, the United States of America and against the UN Commission on Human rights. Pro-regime protests.

Security measures: After heavy gunfire heard yesterday, the police have carried a search operation in the morning. Several men have been taken before being released. Residents of the neighbourhood say they are tired and point the finger at Imbonerakure, saying they shot during the night just to justify the controls the next day.

The celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities in Mpanda was marked by a demonstration march to the stadium of the county. Protesters said they are against the deployment of foreign/UN troops in Burundi and against France and the President of Rwanda, Kagame. At the stadium, the commune administrator read the statement from the interior ministry calling on France not to bring chaos in Burundi as they did in 1994 in Rwanda. Pro-regime protests.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: During the celebration of the day dedicated to municipalities, demonstrations by the ruling party against the deployment of foreign troops in Burundi took place.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On this day dedicated to municipalities, party activists marched against any foreign deployment on Burundi soil, saying that the Country does not need help.
Non-violent activity: Explosions and heavy gunfire heard overnight in Gikoto, Musaga.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A youth was beaten up by four Imbonerakure for welcoming the deployment of 228 UN police in Burundi. They accused him of being a troublemaker of public order.
Soldier reportedly raped and killed a young girl. Her body was found not far from his home.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Between August 3 and August 6, five traders have been stripped and beaten up by a group of Imbonerakure and ex-combatants on Karama, Manga, and Rukere hills of Jene area. They steal and beat with clubs anyone who tries to sell their product in neighbouring Rwanda by Kanyaru river.
Security measures: Police carried out search operations after hearing gunshots on the hill. No weapons were found.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Counter Terrorism Unit
notes: A man was arrested by the Counter Terrorism Unit of the police at the bar "Kumutwenzi" in Heha quarter. This man was beaten up before being taken to an unknown destination. According to a local source, it was neither possible to identify this young man, nor to know the reason for his arrest.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Between August 3 and August 6, five traders have been stripped and beaten up by a group of Imbonerakure and ex-combatants on Karama, Manga, and Rukere hills of Jene area. They steal and beat with clubs anyone who tries to sell their product in neighbouring Rwanda by Kanyaru river.
Non-violent activity: Explosions and gunshots heard in Gitaramuka.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: Security measures: Police and SNR agents raid two houses. The first belonged to an employee of the Bugarama Health Center, who has been accused of caring for rebels. The other targeted 3 of his sons, who are MSD party activists in exile and who are suspected of being enrolled in a rebel movement. No compromising objects were found, but the individuals were taken to an unknown place by an SNR vehicle.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A teacher of the Primary School of Village 1 was arrested by the communal administrator along with the police, who accused him of complicity with the rebel movement. He was taken to the police station where he was beaten up. According to a local source, he facilitates the transfer of money by phone through the Ecocash service, and he was caught by a member of CNDD-FDD who took pictures of the incident in order to accuse him.

A man was shot dead by a commander of the police after he laid down upon police orders. Police had arrested the man and boarded him on a motorcycle; upon reaching the deputy commander, he asked them to let him go, and ordered the alleged wrongdoer to lie down before shooting him. Discontent is rising among residents of Village 3 in Gihanga who speak well of the man and regret that he was killed, especially as he did not flee (as others do when they are accused of something).

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A man tried to kill his wife with a machete due to a political argument. The couple often quarrels because the husband demands his wife to attend meetings of the CNDD-FDD, while the woman is always adamantly opposed to it. This woman seriously injured her fingers as she tried to block the machete. This man was not questioned by the police.
A grenade has been thrown at a police office without causing any victims or damage. The perpetrators are still unknown, but a person has been arrested by the police for investigation.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Between August 3 and August 6, five traders have been stripped and beaten up by a group of Imbonerakure and ex-combatants on Karama, Manga, and Rukere hills of Jene area. They steal and beat with clubs anyone who tries to sell their product in neighbouring Rwanda by Kanyaru river.
A woman was raped last week in a locality where a number of other rapes have occurred at the hands of a group of 5 unknown men.
Weapons Seizure: Police seized a Kalachnikov; a group of children were watering a garden when they made the discovery and alerted their parents.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Two men, returning from a party, were injured by 6 Imbonerakure armed with machetes.

Movement of forces: In a statement, the Government of Burundi announced its refusal to deploy 228 UN security forces, as per UN resolution 2303 adopted on July 29, on the proposal of France. According to the Government, this resolution would be a violation of the sovereignity of Burundi.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A former Burundian Armed Forces soldier has been missing since August 1st. A local source said he responded to a call from an acquaintance around midnight and never returned; he has been missing since that night. His wife searched for him in all the prisons and has not found anything. He had returned from a peacekeeping mission in Somalia three weeks ago.
Two people were injured in a grenade attack in a bar. The reason and the perpetrators of the attack are unknown.

Two people were injured and seven others kidnapped in an ambush by an unknown armed group. The military pursued this group, until the 7 passengers were released. A significant amount of money and phones were stolen according to a local source.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was beaten by Imbonerakure and forced to pay a fee of 5.000BIF for saying that the deployment of UN police on Burundian soil is not a problem for him.

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Burundi)
notes: Exchange of fire between an armed group, who tried to target a civilian, and policemen. The person targeted was able to escape unharmed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Security measures: Imbonerakure searched a woman suspected of carrying weapons in a basket, though when they went to search the basket, they found no weapons.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Around 1,000 people marched to the French embassy to protest UN decision to send police and to the Rwandan Embassy, accusing Rwanda of training Burundi rebels. Protests likely supported by ruling party.
Two men, a father and his son, were seriously injured after a grenade was thrown at their home.
Security measures: Police searched six houses, included the house of a retired military member, without finding any weapons.

Four people were killed and 3 wounded during an attack in a bistro carried out by an unidentified armed group. According to a local source, the group wore military uniforms. The police said that among the dead there was a young criminal wanted by the police in Mugamba for several weeks. A Kalashnikov rifle was seized as well as mobile phones and money stolen.
Arrests: Police arrested 50 people traveling by bus, allegedly with weapons and ties rebel training in Rwanda.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was beaten up by three young Imbonerakure who accused him of having them watched scornfully.
Two people, a taxi driver and his client, were shot dead by an unknown group.
Non-violent activity: Explosions and gunshots heard overnight in Gasekebuye quartier.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was beaten to death by a group of Imbonerakure while they were patrolling the hill. He had been accused of robbery.

A motorcyclist was arrested and beaten up overnight by the police after refusing to stop while trasporting an armed man. He was released on July 27 with the help of 5 hill advisers who testified in his favor.

assoc_actor_2: Herders (Burundi)
notes: A person was wounded by an armed group while they were stealing his herd, resulting with fire exchange between the attackers and military forces who intervened. 34 cows were recovered during the pursuit. According to shepherds who were guarding the cows, the attackers were armed with guns and machetes and some of them were wearing police and military uniforms.

assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Burundi)
notes: Journalist of Great Lakes Info was threatened and beaten up by a policeman in a bar after asking him why he was still in the country while his colleagues have fled the country. On Tuesday 26 July, this officer threatened him again (threatening getting a warrant to arrest him).
The body of a man was found in the sub hill of Bogogwa. He has not yet been identified. The perpetrators and the reason for this crime are unknown, and there were no signs of blows or injuries.
Two youths arrested and beaten up by the police (reportedly for robbery in a market).
A motorcyclist was shot and wounded in the arm by unknown armed people at his home.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A man was shot three times in the head the night of Friday by an armed group who were waiting outside his house. The reasons and perpetrators of the assassination remains unknown for the moment; investigations are underway. A local source said the victim was a former activist of the CNDD-FDD who had been removed from the party before the elections in 2015.

assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Burundi)
notes: Journalist Jean Bigirimana from independent Iwacu newspaper reportedly arrested, but his family could not find him in the jail system and the police deny that he is in their custody. Family fears he may have been assassinated.

assoc_actor_2: Twa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
notes: Two men belonging to the Twa community in Rukanu hill were beaten up by men who were waiting on the edge of a field in which the two Twa men had just stolen things. One of them died of his wounds the next day, and the other is receiving care at the health center of Kirombwe. The identity of the attackers remains unknown.
A woman was stabbed to death in the chest by an unidentified group in Nyamugari hill.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: 3 men were arrested by police and the head of intelligence the night of Wednesday, July 20 for possession of goods reserved for security forces (4 walkie talkies and 3 batteries). They led these men to the office of the Burundian Society Livestock (SOBEL) which closed in 2013, where the materials for which they are accused of being the owners of were held. They were tortured into accepting that they are collaborating with rebel movements. As a result of the confessions, they were transferred overnight to the provincial police station in Bubanza, where they continued to be tortured.

A woman in her 50s was killed with machetes and three of her children were seriously injured by unidentified people armed with machetes and clubs. While the reason for this killing is not yet well known, witchcraft is thought to be the basis for the assassination. According to neighbors of the victim, the perpetrators broke down the front door, attacked the woman, and directed their fire toward the children (which are now hospitalized in Mabayi). Local human rights activists are concerned about the upsurge in killings for alleged witchcraft in this province with 14 murders in less than two months.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man spent the night tied up to a tree in a forest by Imbonerakure after being caught with pieces of meat he had just stolen. Imbonerakure ordered the man to pay a fee of 400.000BIF - half of which would go to Imbonerakure, and the other half to the owner (though a pig does not exceed a sum of 200. 000BIF). Inhabitants in the area have reported that Imbonerakure seem to have replaced the administrative and police authorities, intervening in disputes between residents and cancelling the judgments of the notables.
A body was found in the sub hill of Bumba. The victim had fled to Tanzania in search of work and was stabbed in the head on his way back into Burundi. Investigations underway.

A youth was shot dead by an armed group. According to a local source, the victim was visiting some friends when three men with guns broke into the plot and ordered him to get into the house before shooting him. The criminals escaped and the victim has been taken to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries on the way.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) API Unit
notes: Security measures: SNR and API agents have requisitioned 3 private vehicles on Avenue Moso in Rohero area. SNR and API officers came on board three vehicles and stormed the plot where the vehicles were; they began a search of the vehicles before requesting the standard keys. The reasons for this operation remain unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A trader was arrested and beaten up by Imbonerakure while returning from Rwanda where he was supplying sugars. Imbonerakure reproached him for trading with Rwanda, which is not on good terms with Burundi. About 30 women of the hill went to complain to the OPJ asking for more control and justice.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Burundi (2005-)
notes: The chief of Gikuzi hill was attacked by a family which accused him of belonging to the Tutsi ethnic group and entering their land; they stated that they do not want Tutsi on their plot. Administrative and police authorities promised to take up the case because they say the man does not belong to any ethnic group.

Weapons Seizure: The police seized around 12 grenades during a raid of a house in the Swahili quarter of Kayanza. They were alerted by a woman, who complained of being beaten regularly by her husband. The holder of explosive devices succedeed in escaping before the arrival of the police.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A member of Imbonerakure stabbed to death one of his neighbors. He accused him of pushing his father to commit suicide because of sorcery.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 4 people were beaten up by Imbonerakure in a bar, before being tied up in a police vehicle and held in Makamba police station. These people were accused of theft by the police.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A group of 4 individuals were beaten up by Imbonerakure in a bar in Makamba; they were accused of theft by the police.
A taxi driver was found in bad state on the road Bubanza - Bujumbura; he said he was beaten and threatened with a gun by three men who had rented his car in Bujumbura Saturday, on July 16 at 9pm.
A man was beaten to death by unknown people.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 3 youths were arrested on July 16 for insulting the administrator of the common in a bar, and were led to the prison in town. They were beaten up by the administrator. Released on Monday after payment of a fee of 30.000BIF and 50. 000BI. Two were released on July 18 and the third was released Tuesday, July 19.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A police officer was beaten up by Imbonerakure the night of Saturday. The policeman was ambushed while he was returning home; he replied by firing with his gun and wounding one of the young men. They took his gun and beat him with clubs. The communal administrator intervened but was unable to prevent the Imbonerakure from beating up the police officer.

The meeting of the President of the Republic with the governors and provincial police commissioners has coincided with market day in the town of Rutegama. All the stores were closed from 10am until 2pm. People who tried to cross the road to reach the market were beaten by police and Imbonerakure. A woman who was seriously ill was not allowed to seek treatment. Those who had already arrived at the market could not leave before the departure of the President.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A girl belonging to the same family of an alleged criminal was beaten last July by Imbonerakure in the street near the market Kinama.

Soldiers shot and killed a mentally challenged person after shooting him twice in the chest. The man was reportedly aggressive towards passers-by and wounded a passing military member in the arm with a club. Furious, the military member returned with his colleagues and shot the individual.
Arrests: 500 men arrested by the police in Nyakabiga 2.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A youth was beaten up by 6 Imbonerakure while returning from Rwanda, accused of joining the rebellion. He fled Burundi in April 2015.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
source: Agence France Press; Agence Bujumbura News; RPA; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Former Burundian government minister and spokeswoman Hafsa Mossi was shot dead by unknown assailants armed with automatic pistols and Kalashnikov AK 47. Three suspects arrested on July 21.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) API Unit
notes: A bus driver was beaten by agents of Public Security of Minister General Alain Guillaume Bunyoni, as he had hit a convoy of General Bunyoni near the hotel on the avenue WaterFront.
Two Rwandans shot dead over the night of Thursday by an unidentified armed group.
The body of a man found in Mushoho hill, allegedly with some marks on the neck. According to witnesses, he was strangled using a rope. The perpetrators and motives of the crime are unknown.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A youth member of MSD and his brother (who works as an SNR agent) have been abducted. While the motive of the kidnapping is unknown, the MSD member was suspected of being the mole who betrayed young MSD demonstrators against the third term to the SNR.
A man was hit by a police officer with a rifle butt who accused him of shoving. Residents of the Rukago hill complain about police abuses who beat and extort money.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A man and his mother were beaten up by the intelligence official in Gishubi and a policeman. The man was beaten by two police for taking a second wife; he was beaten up with batons by the police officer and lost consciousness. He was taken to the town prison while he was still bleeding. The mans mother was beaten when she came to help her son.

A man stabbed to death by unidentified men in Sehe hill while returning from a bar the night of Tuesday, July 12. After the killing, the group threw a grenade at the home of the victim. No damage occurred. Witchcraft is thought to be the basis of the assassination.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man beaten up with sticks by 6 Imbonerakure who accused him of going home when they were patrolling.
Security measures: Police search houses and registries. No weapons found.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: A male teacher (who is a memberof the Imbonerakure) sexually abused a student in the 8th grade.
A body was found in North Mutanga. The circumstances of his death remain unknown (some witnesses say he was stabbed, others say he was strangled). The perpetrators and causes of attack are unknown.

Three policemen, along with an informer, broke into a bar and started to shoot at people, causing one to be killed on the spot and another to be injured. A local source said they were searching for alleged rebels.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Security measures: Police and military sources led a search in houses aimed at finding weapons, after being informed about an armed group that had settled in the area. No weapons were found.
The director of a High School in Rutovu was shot dead while returning from a school party. The motive and the perpetrators are unknown.

actor1: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A member of CNDD-FDD was beaten up and seriously injuried by a party of 3 MSD members in a bar due to a political quarel.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: An activist of MSD was beaten up by two members of CNDD-FDD in a bar, who accused him of being part of a group that had stolen the flag of their party in 2010. The activist was rescued by people in the bar.
Four people accused of collaborating with armed groups were tied up and beaten by police in early July.

Two men kidnapped at different times. A first man was abducted after receiving a phone call while he was organising his wedding; the second incident: the first mans brother disappeared after going looking for him.
Weapons Seizure: Police found several weapons - a grenade, ammunition in a military bag and 3 bayonets.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Two men, including a leader chief of CNDD-FDD, were arrested and were severely beaten up by an armed group (the leader chief received several machete blows and remains in critical condition). Neither the motive nor the perpetrators are known.
A man was shot dead in Cishwa while returning from a bistro. Land disputes might be behind this murder.
A young man was killed by 6 unidentified armed men in Mayange hill.
A body was found in Muzazi river, with his genitals mutilated, residents said. They also reported that the man was transported by a vehicle at night.
Property destruction: Gunmen with rifles and grenades attacked shops on Simba hill, Maramvya area. No casualties reported.
After gunmen fired at shops in Simba, they exchanged fire with police. No casualties reported.

Security measures: Police raid the houses of two teachers of High School, in Ruyigi. Nothing has been found. This operation was carried out due to fliers found in the courtyard of the school denouncing the illegitimacy of Nkurunziza power.
Individuals wearing military uniforms stabbed a man to death in Gasenyi, Cibitoke Province.
2 suspected witches killed by a grenade thrown by unknown group.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A trader was abducted by SNR agents while he was fixing his car. He was released on Monday the 4th, after several warnings from his family and human rights defenders. His family couldnt say the sum he had to pay for his release.
Security measures: Soldiers raid Mutakura.
Arrests: Police arrested over 200, including women and children. The mayor lectured them, and they were released.
Troops killed two, injured one civilian and a policemen in ongoing battles with an armed group that the government refers to as "bandits". Secury forces captured four.
Weapons Seizure: Gun found and recovered in Bihanga.
Unknown gunmen from Rukoko nature reserve wound one person using a machete in Gihanga. Gunshots fired.
Rioters burn down a suspected witchs house on Bubogoro hill, Murwi town. No casualties reported.
Military exchanged fire with unknown group after the group wounded a person in Gihanga. Armed group fled back to Rukoko nature reserve.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Clashes between police forces and armed group in Mubuga. A policeman and a civilian member of Imbonerakure were injured. 2 assailants killed, 4 captured. Weapons seized.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: Student kidnapped from Ngagara.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Residents of Nyangungu report that they have been beaten by Imbonerakure. No exact date given for the beatings.
Unknown group beheads a man in Mugerama, reportedly over land conflicts.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Burundi)
notes: Armed student killed two teachers in Ndava. Potentially related to political tensions.
Two men shot dead by unknown armed people. The two were teachers at the primary school and they were ambushed on their way back home from a local bar.
Girl raped by a man reported to have relations with country authorities.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Security measures: During a search conducted by the police, a policeman stole 200.000BIF and a gun in one of the houses searched. The victims complained to the officer leading the operation who immediately suspended the search and took the policeman to the prison to be heard.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A driver of Makamba hospital was beaten up and his driving license torn by SNR agents who accused him of not waiting for the passage of President Nkurunziza.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Demonstrations took place in Mishiha to celebrate the failed coup of 13 May last year. The protesters sang for the President Nkurunziza, armed with clubs (though no damage or violence was reported).

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A former member of the Burundian Armed Forces was forced to get off the bus near the military camp in Muha. Those living near the camp reported to have heard cries of pain from the beatings inflicted upon him. Later, he was taken to the office of the National Intelligence Service to Rohero.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Burundi)
notes: Security measures: The police and the chief of the SNR in Gitega conducted a search in the cells of an alleged rebel within Gitega central prison. Beverages, mobile phones, and radios were seized and the number of daily-based visits were reduced.
Four gunmen attacked a family, setting fire to their house and their stable of goats before leaving the site. The motive and the perpetrators of the attack are unclear.
Weapons Seizure: Police, alerted by a member of FNL, found two Kalashnikov rifles, 110 cartridges and 4 chargers in a small bush of Busebwa hill.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A trader and member of FRODEBU was abducted in Kigoma while she was returning from Uganda; she was released in Buyenzi after two weeks. She had to pay her captors a sum she refrained from revealing. Some eyewitnesses reported she was abducted by SNR agents.

assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: Security measures: Police raid the house of a member of FRODEBU after forcing the main door of the house. His wife fled to Tanzania at the beginning of the Burundi Crisis. The activist left the hill two years ago to join a rebel movement and the police had received information that he had returned with weapons, though no weapons were found.

assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: A municipal elected member of the FNL party was abducted by unknown armed people in a bar called "Maman Subila". Another five people were kidnapped as well, but released afterwards. They were questioned by the police for investigation reasons.

A young man beaten up with several machete blows to the head by unknown people wearing long coats while he was returning home. The motive for the attack remains unknown. Some people said the return of men in long coats -- the "Ba Rukoti" -- had been reported in April 2015 in the area near Kibenga.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi); Muslim Group (Burundi)
notes: A 7th year student of the Islamic School of Nyanza-Lac was arrested by the police for having doodled on the image of President Nkurunziza. He was beaten up by the town administrator before being jailed.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A young man was shot dead by police. According to the police, he was armed with a grenade and a gun, and was suspected of being part of a gang. Yet local residents rejected this version, pointing out that the police, along with Imbonerakure, started shooting at a group of guys chatting, killing one while the others escaped.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Security measures: A team from the Ministry of Education, along with the police, were brought in for inspection of students who damaged the image of the President in their science books. When they arrived, teachers and parents had already replaced the books with doodles with new ones.
Arrests: At the expiration of a government ultimatum, twenty-six "insurgents" were arrested in the southern region. Four reportedly surrendered and handed over a gun, as other weapons were seized.

6 people from the same family died, burned the night of Thursday, June 16. Police say these people were murdered before being burned because their bodies were piled on each other and were in the same room. Land disputes are the cause of this tragedy. A kin of the victims was arrested for investigation.
2 youths killed; several traces of machetes and knives found on their bodies.
A lifeless body of a young woman was found naked in Rukoba. According to the police, she had been raped before being killed.

assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Burundi)
notes: A journalist of "Oximity News" went missing last week. He was arrested by unknown people when he was at home to be held in the SNR jail. (Because he has not been found in the SNR jail, he is considered to be abducted by unknown group.)

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: A member of MSD was arrested and reportedly tortured by the police. The motive is not evident, but one of his neighbor said he might have been accused of joining the protests against the 3rd mandate.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
source: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse
notes: Soldier was preparing to throw a grenade at a crowd when it exploded in his hand, killing himself and two others (including his driver), at least four injured. Police intercepted a second grenade before it exploded.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: Arrests: About 30 students arrested for having scribbling on the photo of the President in their science books. 15 students in Kigangabuko spent 4h in jail.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: Arrests: About 30 students arrested for having scribbling the photo of the President on the science books. In Vumwe, the students have been held overnight.
A young man died in the attempt of throwing a grenade, killing two other people.

A young man was killed in a shooting at 5th Avenue in Kinanira. The dynamic is unclear; according to the police, he was ambushed while showing where weapons were hidden. Yet local residents rejected this version, pointing out that the youth was killed by the security forces that led him from prison to the spot in Musaga to make it look like a firefight with the alleged assailant.
7 people found leaflets threatening death because of sorcery. Their fields were destroyed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: A man was beaten up by Imbonerakure who accused him of insulting them. The victim was released by the chief of the hill who demanded the perpetrators pay all of the healthcare costs of the victim.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: A member of FNL was arrested by Imbonerakure during a night patrol in his area. The individual was released after 11pm after being immersed in a small stream between the Nyarusange and Gihororo hills.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Some local inhabitants reported that Imbonerakure beat passersby with sticks and clubs during night patrols; some were reported to have guns.
Defusal: Workers found a B10 mortar while they were digging the foundation of a school. They called the police to collect it.
A young student was arrested and detained in prison. Released on June 19. His friends said he was tortured and that he could barely speak. The reason for this arrest remains unknown.
Gunmen shot a woman dead in her home. No report of theft, possible connection to the victims husband being imprisoned for political reason

A young worker disappears as his family unsuccessfully looked for him in all the prisons; they fear for his life. Some residents said he was put on a police Pick-up. At the moment of his release, on June 18, he said he was arrested and tortured by 6 soldiers - he reported his arm broken and to have been beaten up with clubs to his feet.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
notes: 2 men, who wanted to flee to Rwanda, were arrested and beaten up by Imbonerakure at the border. The SNR agents brought them to Kirundo.

assoc_actor_1: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Security measures: Following the murder of a woman on June 9, the police patrol the area and accused former soldiers of the illegal detention of weapons and for collaboration with armed movements.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 5 people arrested, beaten up, and stripped of their belongings by Imbonerakure; accused of possession of illegal weapons despite no firearms found.
A political quarrel between 3 policemen and 4 soldiers caused 6 persons to be injured. 2 policemen arrested.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 persons were beaten up by 2 Imbonerakure who accused them of frequenting a bar of a militant MSD, despite the fact that it was forbidden to them. They have promised the Imbonerakure not to set foot in the bar again.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was killed by a policeman in a bar. The opinions on this crime vary. On one hand, some said the officer was drunk and had accidentally shot the Imbonerakure. Others meanwhile say that the officer was annoyed by the songs the Imbonerakure was playing on his phone, stating that the officer had ordered him to turn off the music but when he did not, the officer opened fire, hitting him with a bullet in the head.
Gunman killed a shop owner in a contested neighborhood, no indication of robbery.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was beaten up by 3 of his own party; he was accused of having abandoned the night patrol.

A body of a young man was found not far from Rukoko forest where in May another lifeless body had been found. The victim had received several machete blows to the head and hands, and his feet were tied. Some policemen and Imbonerakure are suspected to be behind the crimes.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: SNR agents arrested and beat a militant of FNL along with his guest on 6th avenue in Village 3. He was accused of supplying "fighters for Alexis Sinduhije". The agents took away three bags of rice that were in his house.
An elderly couple in their 70s were beaten up by the police. The police wanted to be told where their son was. Their son is a former FAB member, accused of joining a rebel movement.
A woman was killed by unidentified armed persons. The assaulters robbed 350.000BIF from her boutique. Local source reported these crimes are committed by rebels.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A former soldier was shot dead in the head in front of his house. He was suspected of collaborating with SNR and for delivering young protesters against the 3rd mandate.
A man was beaten up by the administrator of Cendajuru municipality and the police chief; they accused him of spying.

Two persons killed by an unidentified armed group; the motive is unknown. Local source reported that last week during his visit in the county, President Nkurunziza gave 15 days for criminals to voluntarily surrender and deliver their weapons if they do not want to see police intervening in the area.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was found dying in a street of Gasasa hill. A local source said he was ambushed by unknown persons who stabbed him; he was identified as one who had carried out multiple unpunished attacks in the area.
A man died after being stabbed in the abdomen. The perpetrators and motive are unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: A militant of FNL beaten up by a group of Imbonerakure due to his rejection to join in CNDD-FDD.
Four injured in grenade explosion.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A man was beaten up by Imbonerakure, accusing him of robbery in a boutique; Imbonerakure wanted to kill him, but police intervened to free the man who had his arms already broken.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A trader was beaten up with clubs by Imbonerakure who robbed him of 35.000BIF. He was a veteran of the FDD party and when he went to the OPJ office to complain, he said he suffered for refusing to pay dues to the CNDD-FDD party.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A youth was arrested and beaten up by Imbonerakure while on his way back from a family farm; robbed of his three mobiles and rescued by inhabitants of the neighborhood. The victim said he cant file a complaint because the authorities and the police are already aware of the actions of these Imbonerakure.
Army officer Col. Emmanuel Nibizi injured in grenade attack on his car at the traffic police barracks.
Arrests: A former CNDD-FDD elected official was arrested for describing the ruling party as criminals.
Group of armed men killed well known trader in front of his home. No theft indicated.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat up people in the night patrols, armed with clubs and guns. There were 18 members, of which 8 were armed with kalachnikovs, a victim said.
Defusal: A gun G3 was found by the police after being alerted by the population.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Motorcyclists were beaten up and their motorbikes seized by Imbonerakure; they were accused of having taken part in the protests against the third mandate.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Burundi)
notes: Arrests: A journalist of Bonesha FM was arrested by the police and delivered to SNR; the journalist was accused of spreading information to pro-opposition radio stations based in Rwanda. Released on June 7.
A militant of UPRONA and the chief of Jongwe hill fought due to political quarrels.
Grenade attack. No damage or injuries reported.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: After police arrested secondary school students for defacing photos of President Nkurunziza, hundreds protested. Police opened fire, injuring two students and a passer-by, and later arrested 11 more students suspected of defacement.
Arrests: About 100 young men arrested by the police at the border of Kobero. They were returning from Tanzania where they worked in a tobacco field.

A boy was abducted in Burenza, Muramvya on June3. He was found on June5 in traumatic shock - naked, gagged with legs and arms tied. He recognized the vehicle from his abduction: a vehicle with black windows, allegedly belonging to SNR agents.
Since early month 5 body were found in Tanganyika lac. While three fishermen drowned, other two bodies died in circumstances unclear, one of them had wounds at the head.
An armed group of 5 people attacked a house killing 2 people.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: Gunmen injured MSD member Nzisabira Dieudonne when attacking his home.

assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi)
notes: Non-violent activity: More than 300 secondary school students were suspended from school for defacing a photo of President Nkurunziza in textbooks.
A man was stabbed to death by his neighbor, who accused him of sorcery.
Dead body found in Rukoko forest. The man desappeared on May26; the motive for his death is unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was seriously beaten up with clubs by two Imbonerakure, accused of criticizing them for being responsible for several crimes in the area.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Two imbonerakure beat a man who was trying to reach Rwanda through the Kigeri border; they accused him of wanting to join the rebellion in Rwanda.
Defusal: A mine was found by individuals working in an area; the police were alerted who seized the device.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A member of Imbonerakure was kidnapped by two men in military uniforms, in Bururi quarter of Kinama. A local source said his wife was looking for him at the military position of Mutakura neighborhood; he was allegedly led to an unknown place overnight.
Nine injured in grenade attack on a restaurant.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A grenade was thrown at an Imbonerakure plot. No damage to people or property reported. A member of FNL was later arrested.

Military forces arrested 40 people due to irregularities; they were released after paying 50,000BIF. Following the arrests, military forces beat two youths due & inflicted humiliation upon two other men.

assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The head of the MSD in Mpanda commune was kidnapped in broad daylight at his home in Musenyi and his family has had no news of him.
A couple of traders were attacked and robbed by an armed group in Butamuheba hill. The head of the household was stabbed in the head and in the abdomen, and thereafter taken to the hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: An Imbonerakure and a young motorcyclist were both severely beaten. Imbonerakure hit the motorcyclist with a club; afterward, they started beating each other. The Imbonerakure member remains injured. Following the brawl, the motorcyclist was arrested.
Two injured in grenade attack.
At least two grenade attacks in Bwiza zone. No injuries reported.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A group of residents of Ceru hill were watching the Champions League in a private house when the police and Imbonerakure raided the house, beating them up. The television and decoder were seized, without any motive. On May30 the head of the household complained, arguing that the reason for the seizure was the lack of a bribe payment.
Arrests: 500 people arrested following the grenada attack at the office in Jabe district of Bwiza. No damage reported, people were released after being identified.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Armed men kidnapped off-duty police officer.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: 4 members of Amizero yAbarundi arrested and beaten up by the police and Imbonerakure for the illegal possession of weapons, in Mago, Ndago and Muramba hill. 2 guns were found in the houses of two of them (in the ceiling; members were not armed or fighting back at the time of arrest/beating).

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: Amizero yAbarundi
notes: 4 members of Amizero yAbarundi arrested and beaten up by the police and Imbonerakure for the illegal possession of weapons, in Mago, Ndago and Muramba hill. 2 guns were found in the houses of two of them (in the ceiling; members were not armed or fighting back at the time of arrest/beating).

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: 4 members of Amizero yAbarundi arrested and beaten up by the police and Imbonerakure for the illegal possession of weapons, in Mago, Ndago and Muramba hill. 2 guns were found in the houses of two of them (in the ceiling; members were not armed or fighting back at the time of arrest/beating).
Two people died in an attack carried out by armed people.
A man was killed by machete by an unidentified group. He allegedly denounced people who joined protests against the 3rd term to SNR agents.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Recruitment: Ruling party reportedly distributing machetes and firearms and training youth for the "systematic elimination of opponents of the third term of President Pierre Nkurunziza".

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International
notes: Gunmen killed the chief of judicial police while he was at a beer warehouse. Warehouse owner also injured.
Gunmen killed a guard at ruling party office before trying to torch the building.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International
notes: Gunmen assassinated retired army colonel and wounded his son in a drive-by shooting at their home.
Arrests: The police arrested 29 youths due to irregularities. 25 were released with caution. Arrests for irregularities or without any just cause have become common.
Defusal: 7 grenades in a bag found near a School, in Gabira district. Students and passers-by alerted the police, who seized the bag.
A body was found murdered in Butuhurana hill.
A youth arrested on 12/12/2015 has fallen into a coma, apparently due to poisoning. The prison warden refused to release him for hospitalization.
A man was shot in the chest by an armed group.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was arrested by Imbonerakure and taken to the offices of SNR where he was beaten up.
Two people injured by a grenade launched near a bar in Quarter I, a local source reported. The instigator of the attack is unknown.
A youth was killed by an armed group. He was suspected of engaging with the SNR.
Gunshot heard in Nyakigamo hill; a man was killed. The police station of Mwaro appeared to be the target of the attack.
Gunshot between the police and an armed group who assaulted using a truck.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was beaten up by a group of 10 Imbonerakure in Kabimba hill; he was accused of preventing his son from carrying out night patrol by hiding him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was beaten up at his home and jailed by Imbonerakure. Imbonerakure accused him of having insulted them. The man was released after paying 20,000BIF; he was previously robbed of 31,000BIF.
An elderly woman was stabbed in the shoulder. The motive of the attack is unknown.
A youth was injured by armed people who shot him, accusing him of collusion with the police regarding the arrests of protesters against the third mandate.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: A person (a Red Criss employee) was killed by unknown people armed with guns and grenades in Mirango II neighborhood in Kamenge.
Assault by an armed group in Nzove hill on May21. A local source reported a man died on May23 due to his injuries.
A youth was shot dead by an armed group. He was the cousin of a student who was attacked on Monday at School.
3 injured in Masaka hill after being hit by armed people with machetes, clubs, and guns.
A man was killed with a hit of an axe to the head in Matyazo hill. The motive of this murder is alleged to be sorcery, according to his neighbor.
Security measures: Search operation was carried out by the police, without finding any weapons.

Arrests: The police arrested 29 people in neighbourhood 5 due to irregularities in household registries or based on suspicions. A student from the Agronomic Institut of Zege was taken to an unknown location, while the others were released.
Security measures: Police searched houses in Kigwati neighborhood; no weapons were seized.
A body was found, killed by a shot to the head.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: Arrests: Police and military forces arrested 25 people, 24 of which were released later on.
Fire fight between the police and an armed group; 1 person wearing military uniform was killed and 4 grenades and military uniforms were seized.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure tortured other members of their party, accusing them of damage to the image of the party.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: A militant of CNDD-FDD was killed. His wife and his brother-in-law, an FNL activist, were arrested for investigation. (It is difficult, however, to connect the incident to his political affiliation and the alleged perpetrators.)
Security measures: Police searched houses belonging to military and former military officers in Kabusa neighborhood; no weapons found.
A murdered body was found; the deceased had allegedly been accused of sorcery. 3 suspects were arrested and interrogated.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Security measures: Imbonerakure searched for prohibited beverages in several locations, armed by machetes.

A man was beaten to death by Gahinda inhabitants, allegedly for belonging to a rebel movement. The province has been affected by fear following the suspected presence of a rebel group behind the recent bloody attacks of the past weeks.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Burundi)
notes: Students of a high school throw stones at a schoolmate accused of denouncing people involved in the third mandate protests.
Rioters attacked 3 policemen by throwing stones at them to defend a former military officer who was beated by 3 policemen.

assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: An activist of FRODEBU was wounded with a machete by 3 unidentified people.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: 3 policemen beat a former military officer, accusing him of wanting to overthrow "their president".

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)

notes: The Imbonerakure and Ivyuma vyindege - a pro-Rwasa youth group affiliated with the FNL - fought in Kivyevi hill, armed with machetes and clubs; causing two to be seriously wounded. The police intervened to stop them.

actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure assaulted a soldier. He is arrested by military officers the following day.
A policeman was beaten and tied up by two men who tried to steal his weapon (which he didnt have with him at the time of the incident).

In Masa hill, a man was killed by unknown people. The reason for the murder is not yet known, but information gathered may indicate that the person worked with the police and the administration by looking after young people linked with armed groups in Burambi area.
2 people were injured by a grenade thrown at a house.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Demonstrations took place from Vumbi to Gasura, in order to celebrate the first anniversary of the failed coup of 13 May last year.
A grenade was thrown at a house. No injuries were reported.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Activists of CNDD-FDD party and members of the Collective of Associations for the Integrated Development of the Population (CODIP) marched in demonstration to commemorate a year of the failed putsch. They also used slogans against Belgium and Rwanda -- allegedly accomplices of the enemies of Burundi.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Demonstration tok place over the anniversary of the failled coup detat, led by militants of CNDD-FDD party.

assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: An activist of FRODEBU was beaten to death by unknown people. While difficult to link the incident to his political affiliation, some local residents accused a group of Imbonerakure who stop people during the night, beating up and robbing them of their goods and possessions at times
1 person was killed and 21 others injured in a grenade attack on a restaurant in the Bwiza area.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: During the commemoration of the failed coup, a member of Imbonerakure went into 2 local bars, beating 2 people accused of having rejoiced at the failed coup last year.

Riots occurred during a raid in a communal high school. Students threw stones at the police and beat the Director who tired to calm them. 12 arrests were made, including the real target of the operation, who was taken to the SNR office.
Demonstrations were led by the Makamba governator, in order to celebrate the first anniversary of the failed coup of 13 May last year.

Unidentified detonates grenade, wounding 7.

A local leader of a Burundian opposition party was killed in a grenade blast on Sunday night [30 May]. Another member of the same party also escaped an assassination attempt.

At 6:00 pm (1600 GMT) UPDs deputy chairman in Buhinyuza commune Asumani Nzeyimana was talking to some people when someone in police uniform threw a grenade at them. It exploded and caused him fatal injuries.
Clashes erupted in Burundis capital Saturday in the first violence linked to last weeks disputed local polls, with several people wounded and arrested.

Change to armed group: Burundis largest armed groups, including everyone but the FNL, have formed a single national army known as the National Defense Force.

Agreement: More than 3,000 children who served with the Burundian armed forces, the civilian militia known as the "Guardians of Peace," and various rebel groups have been demobilized in a process that began in December 2004.

More than 150 rebels infiltrated Giharo Commune in Nyamateke where they killed one person, stole about 10 cows before going towards Kinyinya, probably a step towards the Musongati Commune.
In Mukabira, Bururi Commune rebels killed and feasted on a cow belonging to a local farmer. They also attacked and burned Buhiga community college and looted the area. Also burnt cars and a home.
A rebel ambush left three dead and eight wounded. A vehicle was burnt to a shell and another extensively damaged.

Fighting between rebels and government forces at Buga in Kayogoro Commune. Two rebels were killed. The government forces continued with their offensive in Nyarubanga. At least 200 rebels, massed towards Gifunzo in Rutana Province, were engaged in battle.
One person was killed by rebels, and more than 15 cows were stolen in Musenyi, Cankunzo Province.
Three rebels fell victim to an ambush laid by the regular forces in an operation in Mpinga, Kayove Commune in Nyakabanda Sector.
At least 15 people were killed when rebels fired onto a bus in Kinama.

There was fighting in Karera-Shanga Sector in Musongati Commune between rebels and government. Three rebels were killed and two others who were wounded taken prisoners. Four soldiers were wounded, one seriously.

There was an attempted rebel attack on Buga centre in Kayogoro. An injured rebel was taken prisoner. The rebel positions of Gasana, Buhema and Buga sanctuaries were reinforced by new rebels who infiltrated into the country across the border.
20 people were killed and some 20 others wounded when a bus was ambushed 15 km northeast of Bujumbura on the highway number one linking Kigali [Rwanda] to Bujumbura.
Following an ambush of civilians, rebel and government forces clash.
Rebels who had blocked the Gatereni-Butare main road in Bukemba near Mugombwe Primary School were flushed out by government forces. One rebel was killed, and two soldiers wounded.
One of a group of rebels was killed by security forces while they were launching an attack in Kihange, in Kibabo commune.

Rebels attacked Butare sector, Bukemba Commune, Rutana Province. The provisional death toll is 15 civilians killed and the communal school office block and a classroom were set on fire.
Nyanza Lac Commune residents joined government forces in tracking down the rebels who had come to replenish their food stocks. Four people were killed (unspecified from which group)
Three people were killedy in an ambush by rebels on the Bujumbura-Rumonge road, near the Dama river, one kilometre from Rumonge town.

On 22 December 2000, the Rwegura, a Burundian boat, was also attacked on its way back from Mpulungu [northern Zambia]. It was accosted by three small patrol boats coming from Mount Kungwe in Tanzania which ordered it to draw up alongside.
a group of " young guardians of peace" from Mugara in Rumonge Commune killed three rebels and they suffered one casualty during a night attack.
Fighting in Vugizo Commune, Mpinga Zone. Rebels from Mabanda tried to capture Vugizo. Two soldiers were killed, and five unconscious rebels left on the battle ground.

Rebels were looking for houses belonging to civil servants or soldiers in order to burn them. They continued kidnapping children.
Rebels ambushed vehicles along the Bujumbura-Bugarama road, at Mageyo.A former interior and public security minister, Col Mandi Stanislas, was killed during the ambush and two others.
Rebels and government clash, 5 soldiers and about 10 rebels dead
Fighting continues in Kayogoro between rebels and government.
Rebels are being pursued by security forces in Makamba province.
Rebels and government troops clash near Kivoga and Maramvya [north of Bujumbura]. Casualties of the operation are not yet known.
Fighting between rebels and government troops resumed in Tenga.
Rebels and government forces clash, 3 rebels killed.

Rebels and government clash in Mboza.

The neighbourhood of Kinama, north of the capital, was attacked by unknown thieves. They killed four people and injured four others. According to witnesses on the spot, the aggressors came from Itenga and are in collusion with the population.

Rebels from Tanzania attacked the Gasirwe sector in Cendajuru Commune, Cankuzo Province [eastern Burundi]. The bandits kidnapped one person and looted nine houses, including a shop which they later razed to the ground.
Two days after a previous attempt, there was a fresh attempt at infiltration into Burundi by a rebel group. It once again failed. Four genocidal militants were injured.
Demonstrators gather in the capital to protest the Arusha peace meetings in Tanzania. They are met by Burundian security forces (ten arrested).

Towards the end of February 2000, a group of Burundian rebels tried to infiltrate Burundi at the night through the Tanzanian area of Musenga, which borders Kabanga Zone, Kinyinya Commune, Ruyigi Province [eastern Burundi]. The group hit an anti-personnel
Five government soldiers killed in a rebel ambush. near the Rumonge [southwestern Burundi] barracks.

Rebels attacked the area of Musaga, Kinanira II (on 12th, 13th and 14th avenues) in the southern part of the capital, Bujumbura. One of the rebel leaders, Nyabenda, was killed. One civilian also died.
Rebels also attacked Kabezi Commune in Bujumbura-Rural [Province]. The attack left two people dead, a rebel and a civilian. Four others were wounded.

Attacks by government forces on rebel positions continued in the south, with pressure mounting on Buga, Manyenye and Rubindi areas in order to prevent infiltration and destroy existing rebel positions, military sources say. About 10 rebels were killed in
Government forces kill 3 suspected rebels.
The army intervened after 17 rebels attacked Ruyigi, torching a medical centre.
Rebels killed one person in Mutambara sector, Gatete zone.
Rebels burnt down six houses in Gitaba Zone, precisely on Gasakuza and Kivumvu hills. A local resident was killed.

Government forces clash with rebels in Musongati.

The government army has launched an offensive against rebel positions at Mwura in Giharo Commune in Rutana Province [southeastern Burundi]. 2 government soldiers and several rebels were killed. The army had surrounded the rebels whose retreat route they
Rebels attack the village of Makebuko in Musongati. They looted a health centre and damaged buildings before taking hostages and fleeing into the Rusumo and Kagunzi hills.
20 people were killed in southeastern Rutana Province as security forces pursued a rebel group. (some of those killed included those who had been kidnapped.)

Armed gangs were trying to steal from houses and five people were killed and a military vehicle was hit by bullets from the gangs in Nyabaranda District, Kanyosha, in the southern part of the capital. The area is also called Gisyo or Kumusufi.

An armed gangkilled two watchmen and the driver of a businessman in Bukeye [central Burundi]. One of the criminals was killed and the others took away seven cows and eight pigs before retreating into the Kibira Forest.
Thirteen people have been killed and seven injured in a rebel attack in Muramvya in central Burundi.

Sixteen people were killed and around ten were injured during an ambush by rebels in Mpehe, Bugarama Zone, about 8 km from the Muramvya urban centre (centre-west). Assailants attacked three vehicles, including a minibus, a pick-up and a truck on the Buju
