notes: A boat the Lengwe was hijacked and disappeared without trace at the beginning of December 2000 on its way to Mpulungu (Zambia).

Rebels disturbed peace in Commune Butanganzwa, Ruyigi Province [eastern Burundi]. Two primary schools, the zonal office and many houses were razed to the ground by rebels. The representative of Oxfam-UK was ambushed by the same rebels along the Kinyinya-
Rebels injured one person riding a motorbike near Cugaro, on National Road Number Three, in Minago Zone, Rumonge Commune.

Violent fighting took place between 30 rebels in Mwaza (a former coffee factory in Majama sector) operating from an improvised rebel camp and security forces. (several casualties on both sides-exact number unspecified.)
In Rumonge Commune [western Burundi] three people were killed and some 20 others wounded when they were ambushed by gunmen. The victims were on their way to the fields.
Important rebel post located at Rumpungwe close to Gisuru. (when established uncertain)
33 rebels and two army soldiers were killed in a violent fighting. The rebels managed to withdraw to the south of Giharo in the direction of Gisuru.
Hutu rebels attacked Nyabitare, Gisuru Commune [eastern Burundi, near Tanzanian border], killing three people and setting homes ablaze.

A group of military from the Mubone mobile battalion stopped some civilians. They divided them into two groups and killed them with firearms: the first group in a field, and the second inside some buildings. Some of the victims have been identified. They

Government forces carried out, as a precaution, an operation in Kinama without seriously shaking up the rebel presence which stretches to Mubimbi [northeast of Bujumbura, Bujumbura-Rural Province]. (no reported casualties)
A rebel attack on public transport vehicles at Bugarama on National Road One, around 0630 [local time], left two people dead. One vehicle was set ablaze and another was damaged.
A pick-up vehicle in the service of the First Paratroops Battalion commander was ambushed "without major damage". One of the soldiers escorting the vehicle was evacuated to the military hospital.
The rebels infiltrated the local population in Giharo Commune [southern Burundi] where they carried out looting in Nyankara. (one rebel was killed in Buga)

The Burundi government forces have launched an offensive in Ruyigi Province in a bid to put an end to the ideological awareness campaign orchestrated by the propaganda committees of the Hutu rebel movements which are particularly active in Kinyinya and N

A Burundian MP, Gisabwamana was killed by armed men in Bujumbura. (it is not certain that the assailants were Burundian soldiers, sources also claim the possibility that he was killed by Hutu rebels.)
An executive of the Catholic NGO Caritas based in the eastern DR Congo town of Uvira was killed on Sunday in the Burundian capital Bujumbura.
Armed rebels have planted land mines, especially in Bururi and Makamba provinces [southern Burundi].
Rebels attacked Nkondo area on the eastern slopes of Samvura Mountain in Mabanda Commune (southern Burundi) killing six people and wounding a number of others.
Ten gunmen were killed and two Burundi government troops wounded during fighting in northern Bujumbura in Gituro District, Kamenge Zone.

Rebel gangs killed three people on Monday night in an attack on a camp for displaced people at Karindo, near Rutana. Two other people were seriously wounded and three houses were set on fire during the attack which came one day after new provincial gover
Rebels killed 18 people and injured 16 others in the camp for the displaced of Nyarusenda.
17 people were killed and 22 others wounded when armed gangs attacked the displaced persons camp of Rudehe, Matongo Commune (northern Burundi).

actor1: PALIPEHUTU-FNL: National Forces for Liberation-Party for the Liberation of the Hutu People
notes: A grenade has exploded at the Bujumbura central market. Four people have been killed and over 10 others injured. (later was discovered that the FNL were responsible)
11 people were knifed to death in Kinyosha, a southern district of the capital Bujumbura. (after a clash between security forces and rebels)
15 rebels were killed when they attacked military positions in Gishingano and Muyira in Bujumbura-Rural, western Burundi, near Bujumbura town. A soldier was also killed.
Rebels and security forces clash in Kanyosha.
Twenty assailants and two soldiers were killed when the security forces clashed with the militant genocide perpetrators at Nyambuye [northeastern Bujumbura, in Bujumbura Rural].
Rebels kill 12 civilians in Kavumu in Muramvya province.
Thirteen people, including 10 civilians, were killed and 12 were wounded in an ambush by Hutu rebels in Musenyi, central Burundi.

Two policemen were killed and three more wounded in an attack in the Mubone area of Buterere in northern Bujumbura overnight. The attackers had come from the Tenga and Bugoma areas of Bujumbura rural district.
Security forces and rebels clash in Bujumbura. One person killed. (not specified from which side.)
Security forces kill 20 rebels in Ruziba in Bujumbura-rural.

Rebels attacked Kagongo area in Giharo Commune [southeastern Burundi] where they killed two civilians and wounded five others. Local residents indicated that the assailants had come from the Nyakazu mountains [southeastern Burundi].
The army killed three rebels during a mopping up operation at Muhafu still in Giharo Commune.
Rebels attempted to attack Gihosha but were repulsed by security forces. 3 civilians were killed in the fire exchange.
Rebels attacked Mpehe Hill [phonetic] in Bugarama Zone, Muhanza Commune with guns, grenades and blades, they killed more than 30 people on the spot.
Clashes between the rebels and government troops were reported in an area north of Bujumbura.

15 rebels were killed in an exchange of fire between government troops and rebels near Bujumbura. Government sources referred that the fighting took place in Ruziba, south of the capital. 6 soldiers were also killed.
Rebels attack Bujumbura, around Gihosha in Bujumbura municipality.
Rebels shelled the districts of Mugomere and Birimba, in Rumonge town but no damage has been reported.

10 people were killed and three others injured in an ambush by armed gangs in Cugaro, Minago Commune, 20 km north of Rumonge. The victims were travelling in a pick-up from Bujumbura. After committing the crime, the assailants retreated to Minago Zone.

A UNICEF-UNHCR delegation and administration officials were attacked by rebels. hey had gone to Rutana within the framework of the distribution of assistance to people regrouped in the Murye protection camp. Some of these people, whose number is still un

notes: Residents of neighbouring zones and security forces, together managed to chase the rebels away from Rukambasi. Several rebels were killed, although exact numbers are unknown.
Rebels retreated to Rukambasi Hill, where they have set up their Makamba base.
Soldiers manning the Mubimbi position in Bujumbura-Rural Province were caught unaware during a rebel attack. Four soldiers were killed and 10 others were wounded.
A pick-up was ambushed by genocidal militants in Mutambara, Rumonge Commune (southwestern Burundi), at the entry point to the Rumonge Natural Reserve. None of the passengers in the vehicle died.
In Bujumbura-Rural Province, a sad incident took place yesterday in Ruyaga, due to confusion. A soldier killed six people.

Eleven people from a single family , including three brothers and two of their wives, five children and a student from a local communal secondary school were killed at Giharo in Rutana Province (southeastern Burundi).

Rebels attacked Kinama Zone [Bujumbura] and killed 11 people and a teacher. They also injured five people, burnt down a house and looted a shop. An assailant was also killed in the attack which took place at around 2030 [local time] in Kanga One area.
Surprise rebel attack on a military position in Mkenga-Busuro sector, near the Kanyoshs district.

Five people were killed in clashes that followed an overnight rebel attack on a military position on the outskirts of the Burundian capital. 3 Soldiers were also injured. (residents claimed 3 soldiers, 2 civilians and 6 rebels were killed however.)
Security forces killed 30 rebels and captured three rifles at Burima in Mutambu commune.
Rebels kill 7 civilians including children with machetes.

Strategic raids were conducted in the northern neighbourhoods of Bujumbura by Tutsi militiamen backed by regular soldiers. 40 Hutu civilians were killed in the raids. Four children and one functionary of the Finance Ministry, all of the Hutu ethnic group

There was a shooting in the neighbourhoods of north Mutanga and Gasenyi, where many civilians were killed near the psychiatric hospital. The home of Hutu parliamentarian, Nestor Niyonzima, was looted and his car set on fire. It is believed that the

Rebels attempted to attack Mutanga Nord but were confronted by security forces.

Armed gangs yesterday attacked Munyika sector in the Mpinga-Kayove sub-location.According to the toll provided by the governor of the province eight people were killed, four wounded and three went missing. Five houses and one vehicle were burned
The rebels attacked Gatoke estate and killed four cows and wounded many others. One soldier was killed and four rebels were shot dead.
Rebels killed six people when they attacked Kangozi trading centre, Rutana Province, southeastern Burundi.

Rebels attacked Musongati Commune, the local health centre and primary school were burned and four civilians killed. Then in the same area the rebels attacked people at Mwishanga, and according to the advisor to the provincial governor, the communes of M
Fierce fighting between rebels and government forces.
Assailants once again attacked the Musaga suburb. The area stretches along Kanyosha River in southern Bujumbura.
Government forces clash with rebels at Kigomagoma. Two rebels were killed.
Fighting between rebels and government forces. Casualties unknown. Civilian sources indicated that a large number of rebels had moved towards Inanzegwe because of the fighting.
Rebels attacked two vehicles in Kivoga, 10 km north of Bujumbura, killing five people who were burnt alive and injuring an as yet unknown number of others.
An elderly woman was killed last night and two people wounded during a rebel attack on Gasenyi suburb, Kamenge District, north of the capital [Bujumbura].

A group of armed assailants attacked areas bordering River Ntahangwa [northern outskirts of the capital, 3 km from city centre]. The security forces intervened swiftly which helped to limit the damage. The provisional toll stands at five civilians killed
Around 12 civilians were killed by rebels in Kayogoro.
Criminal gangs attacked Kayogoro chief town in Makamba Province [southern Burundi] killing eight people and wounding several others.
Three people were killed, three vehicles damaged and properties stolen when hutu rebels attacked Kinama. The neighborhoods of Cibitoke and Kamenge were hit.

Six soldiers and 60 rebels were killed during six days of fighting between the army and Hutu rebels around the Burundian capital. The clashes took place in the Mutambu district in Bujumbura rural province. Seven soldiers and about 100 rebels were wounded
At the same time as an attack by Hutu rebels that day, a gang of Tutsi rebels raided the same areas. There have however been no confirmations on whether the two groups entered in direct contact.
Hutu rebels and government troops clashed in Mageyo and nearby Bugara.
The rebels later ambushed a vehicle belonging to the aid organization CARE at Makombe, injuring its occupant, the report said. It did not specify when the raid happened.

A heavy exchange of gunfire was heard in northern Bujumbura, notably in Mutanga Nord, Gihosha and Mugoboka. The assailants, who were trying to infiltrate the areas, were met by a counteroffensive from security forces who killed three of them.

Fighting was reported in Musaga (southern Bujumbura) between the regular army and the rebels but no casualties were reported.
Gunfire between government troops and rebels has been heard in Musaga Zone, Kanyosha district, Nkinga and Busoro [all in southern Burundi].

Rebel groups from Musigati burst into Bubanza Province where they looted food and household items in Masango ward. The rebels killed the head of the ward and slightly wounded a woman.
The chief of Rutegama location in Isale Commune [western Burundi], Mr Bernard Ngendabanyikwa, was shot dead by armed gangs in a house in Rugaragara market place, 1 km from the main provincial town.

An armed group attacked Rushubi location [in western Burundi]. As a result, two civilians were killed, a soldier was wounded and a house was set ablaze. The attack lasted nearly two hours.
A young boy was killed and another wounded by an antipersonnel mine on Mbabazi hill, Ruzo ward, in Giteranyi Commune, Muyinga Province (northeastern Burundi).

A multitude of assailants attacked Makamba urban centre. Heavy gunfire was heard in many areas of the province.
three people were killed and many more injured following an ambush by assailants in Gisenyi Zone, five km south of the Makamba provincial HQ (southern Burundi).
Assailants exchanged gunfire with the army at Gisenyi ward. They looted many kiosks, shops and several bars.
